Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, small boutique and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: amw123
Reviews.Content: A group of us stayed at the hotel at the end of March to celebrate a birthday. The hotel staff were extremely friendly, very helpful and catered to our needs perfectly. Little touches like wishing a "Happy Birthday" without it even being mentioned (except in an email a couple of weeks before) just added to the experience. Also they very helpful in recommending restaurants in advance of our stay. We had 5 rooms in total, a mixture of classic double and superior rooms. The classic rooms were small but this is very common in Paris, however they were very comfortable, clean and the decor was stylish and modern. Free wifi was another great bonus. The location of the hotel is excellent, about 2 minutes walk to Saint Lazarre train and metro station and plenty of restaurants in the area when you start wandering about. Would definitely recommend the hotel and hoping to visit again very soon.

Reviews.Title: “6 days in paris”
Reviews.Author: amr g
Reviews.Content: the hotel is great in many side.location is perfect .near to san lazar metro station.near to the most location which you need to visit.staff are very polite and aware about paris .they realy help me to find out my way.rooms is perfect .service is great .breakfast is good.thanks for all .specialy for Delphen ..thank you delphen.and many thanks to the front desk manager. amr

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff + Clean/Modern Rooms = Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: DStevely
Reviews.Content: Even before our visit i found the staff to be very helpful when it came to recommending restaurants and making bookings for our stay. On our arrival on Sunday afternoon on the 25th we were greeted at the front desk by an exceptionally helpful and friendly member of staff who gave further advice on places to visit. The rooms are small (most rooms in Paris are) but very clean and modern with everying you could possibly need. The thing that struck me most was just how quiet the surroundings were considering we were on the first floor of a centrally located parisien hotel. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel, perfect location and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Paul H
Reviews.Content: The hotel is easy to find as its located within walking distance of Saint Lazare Train Station. Upon arrival to the hotel we were greeted by a very friendly member of staff, we quickly checked in and saw our room. It's a good size for Paris and incredibly clean and fresh. The room and the bathroom were nicely decorated and set out. One of the great benefits of the hotel is it's excellent location, as its just two streets away from Place de la Concorde. We used 'Concorde' as the way to navigate around paris as it's the beginning of the Champs-Élysées, you can see the Eiffel Tower and it's next to Jardin des Tuileries, which from their you'll find Musée du Louvre. After 'Concorde' you'll see the Seine river and all of Paris's elegant bridges. The area close to the hotel is lovely, a small park is 30 seconds away, which is a nice place to spend a morning with a coffee and a Pain Au Chocolat before heading out to explore. A member of staff recommended Le Carré, which is a restaurant about a minute from the hotel. The food was excellent and so was the service. To summarise, the hotel's service, cleanliness and location are exceptional given the price of the stay, even if the price was higher the service would still be excellent. We would most definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Exellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Robin P
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights in march 2012 with my fiancee. Was really satisfied with EVERYTHING in this hotel. the staff was friendly and very helpful, everyone spoke english good so we understood eachother without issues. Always clean rooms, almost spotless. nothing at all to complain about. the hotel is really close to the saint lazare trainstation if u need it. 40min- 1 hour walk to the eiffeltower, very close to both Printemps and gallery Lafayette shopping malls (shoppers dream) Rooms were small yes, but what do u expect, and who cares if they are small, u are not on vacation to spend the time at your room. they might have been small, but there was not anything missing in them. flat screen tv, big bed, nice and fresh bathroom. this is our room, i have no idea how the other rooms were, but i doubt that they are any less fresh and clean. The whole hotel was fresh and modern. can really recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: WendyStephen92
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 9 nights (10/3 to19/3) in the Eiffel room. We found the room was great, cleaned every day and the view of the tower every night from the window and balcony was just sensational. The staff here were fantastic and friendly and were ready to assist with everything. It is not the most expensive hotel in Paris, it is modern and should be high on anyone's list to stay. There was a good selection of food for breakfast, pastries, cereals, fruit with hot and cold drinks. Room service was available. This hotel is within walking distance to everywhere if you are so inclined, took us half hour to walk to the Eiffel tower and about the same to the Louve and seine river, matter of fact most tourist attractions are in walking distance. A major train station (Gare Saint Lazare)100 meters away and there was no noise here at night, just a very quite location, but yet is very close distance to numerous restaurants. Shopping wise, if your so inclined, is just a 10 minute walk to Galeries Lafayette and numerous other cheaper shopping areas as well. We would have no hesitation in staying here again, and in fact when we do go back to Paris this will be our hotel of choice, just can't say enough good things about it. Thanks to the staff for a great time. See you next time.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Little Room A Girl Could Ask For!”
Reviews.Author: amief
Reviews.Content: It's steps from a delicious boulangerie, a corner market, a dozen great restaurants, and has the friendliest staff. I was worried about my limited and humble French, but the front desk was more than accommodating and happy to help us find train stops, things to do, and places to eat. The room is small but, like so many others have said, well designed, and you will want for nothing.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Emma T
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely fantastic. My husband and I had a long weekend break in Paris (our first ever visit) and we were really pleased with the service, ambience, decor and location. The staff were always exceptionally helpful on any requst that we had. We had a beautful Superior Room with Balcony on the 5th floor which I can highly recommend. Will definitely return again. Thankyou!

Reviews.Title: “Definately a nice city hotel”
Reviews.Author: hkoepper
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the WO for 2 nights and had everything we needed. The room was small but clean and nicely funished. The view was amazing (5th floor incl. balkony) and the location is quite but central. I would come back! The only little thing they could improve is the competence of the reception: they were nice and tried to be helpful but couldn't help without exactly telling them what to do. However, I can recommend the hotel very much!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel, perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Gail F
Reviews.Content: Could not have asked for a more perfect hotel in a perfect location, with all of the modern amenities, including in-room tea service, comfortable bed, nice fixtures and a wonderful shower. Quiet, clean, well-organized rooms were a plus (mine even had a balcony with a view - could see the top of the Eiffel Tower), and helpful staff. Was fortunate enough to stay here twice in a two-week period and was very happy both times. Can easily walk to most major Paris attractions and major stores (or if you'd rather not walk, two metro stops - one being the well-connected St. Lazare - are less than 5 minutes away) and it is in a great part of town. I look forward to returning!

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: Matthew H
Reviews.Content: Small but perfectly performed. Great position in relation to metro and the usual attractions. Very helpfull staff.

Reviews.Title: “very friendly personnel combined with a perfect:"what I need" rooms”
Reviews.Author: kaibar
Reviews.Content: the wilson opera is a perfect choice for your paris stay. the hotel is good located next to the gare lazzare. the room is small but well designed. it is equipped with comfort goodies such as sleepers and bathrobe. the staff is very friendly and sebastian the owner is really familiar with local gastronomy scene. C&A from zurich, switzerland

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Easy to access, Good prices, Comfy”
Reviews.Author: Nicolas V
Reviews.Content: Well, I've got nothing to say except that it's a good deal if you are looking for a nice hotel not too expensive for what it is ! My title explain everything. The staff is sweat. The BREACKFAST is just perfect, not too much, good and fresh product such as squeezed orange juice, fruite are welcome when we need C Vitamins.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Supasta M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at hotel WO recently, great service, the conceirge was incredibly helpful and got us really good deals on restaurants and attractions. There's someone at reception 24hours. Fantastic location, just a 5 minute walk from St. Lazare which is one of the biggest metro stations and roughly a 20minute walk from all of the paris attractions. Rooms were slightly small but incredibly comfortable and clean. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “amazing paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: jade h
Reviews.Content: went there in Jan 2011 with a friend. booked a twin room and although room was small (although in Paris this is a common thing) it was beautiful. comfortable beds, enough storage space for our 5 nights worth of baggage and the bathroom was well equipped. shower was excellent. didnt have any breakfast while here but other guests seemed pleased. Staff were extremely helpful and all spoke excellent English as my friends French is terrible. We arrived quite late at night but was no problems and on one evening after returning spent a good while speaking to the man on reception about France and Paris in genenral. On departing we had a few hours to kill after checking out until our flight but the staff were more than happy to keep our cases in the concierge for us. All in all an excellent hotel in an excellent location. Main train station round the corner and within walking distance to the Galeries Lafayette :)

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful Parisian gem”
Reviews.Author: Rachael R
Reviews.Content: We booked to go to Paris for a birthday treat for my fiance, so pleased we booked this lovely hotel as our experience was great from start to finish!! The reception staff welcomed us in a really friendly way (even though our French was a little rusty) explained everything perfectly and even talked us through a map of the area to assist with sightseeing. The room was small, stylish with a perfectly french feel as well as a really comfortable bed and an immaculate bathroom which made clever use of the space provided!! Breakfast is served until 11am which is ideal if you have overindulged the night before! Situated a small distance from the station Gare St Lazare it is also within easy walking distance to Le Galleries La Fayette and the Place de la Concorde at the start of the Champs Elysses. The Opera Garnier is also close by. From Gare du Nord it cost us 10 euros by taxi and 14 from the hotel to the Eiffel Tower. On departure day, the staff made checkout very simple and ordered a taxi which arrived in less than five minutes. Absolutely fabulous hotel, highly recommended and we cannot wait to start planning our next trip to Paris!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Wilson Opera - nonpareil en Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Bruno139
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel on Tripadvisor and booked solely on the reviews we read. After 8 days enjoying Hotel WO's hospitality, we were left with one question...Why isn't it ranked No. 1 ?! Our flight came in to De Gaulle at 5:55 in the morning and we took a taxi (47 euro + 3 euro tip) straight to the hotel. The staff was awaiting our arrival and facilitated our check-in at 10am! Also, because it was the low season, the owner upgraded us to a 5th floor room with a balcony! We don't need to tell anyone that this was a great start to our Paris vacation :) The hotel and rooms are admittedly small, but then most European hotel rooms are. Hotel WO's rooms however, are intelligently designed and you won't want for anything in the space alloted. Besides, being greeted by the morning sun over Parisian rooftops and the Eiffel Tower shining in the distance makes it all worthwhile. The hotel is in a great location too. It is within walking distance to Galeries Lafayette and Printemps department stores (don't go on weekends, seems like everyone in Paris is here). Gare St. Lazare, one of the main transport hubs is a mere minute down the street. However, we recommend taking the time to learn the bus routes. You miss so many sights if you rely on the Metro. It is quicker but, you're in Paris man, what's your hurry? :) The hotel's excellent staff, especially Sophie, Lorrie and Omar went out of their way to plan day trips and sightseeing strategies for every SINGLE day of our stay. The incomparable owner, Monsieur Sebastien Grandchamp suggested restaurants, showed them to us on Google, booked us tables and even walked us thru the directions necessary to get there. Needless to say, his suggestions were the meals we enjoyed the most! Finally, when the sad time came to leave, check out was hassle free, and Monsieur Grandchamp even walked us to our taxi to say au revoir. Thus ended the best vacation ever. Merci beaucoup Sebastien, we will definitely stay at Hotel WO again the next time we are in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Great option to stay in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Carolina312741
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel very good. The staff is really friendly, the amenities very comfortable and in a very comfortable location, just a block away of station Gare St. Lazare, that connects you with the rest of the city. Although the rooms are quite small, everything was enjoyable. Had a very pleasant time.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Jason G
Reviews.Content: A great find in Paris to wrap up our two week European vacation! Located within walking distance of Gare St. Lazare, however the main attractions in Paris are a further walk. There are several bistros and brasseries around the hotel. The staff was very friendly, they upgraded our room and gave us a better view once they found out we were in Paris celebrating our first wedding anniversary. However the staff was not as helpful, we asked for a restaurant suggestion and the man at the front desk gave us walking directions and even wrote them down, however upon arriving what was to be the restaurant there was no restaurant. We walked around the surrounding area and still no sign of the restaurant he had suggested so we settled for another bistro. This hotel is a pretty good value, Paris is such an amazing city so the walks to the main attractions were a lot of fun and we never felt unsafe in any of the surrounding neighborhoods. From what we had read before leaving this hotel had larger rooms than you typically find in Paris but from American standards it was quit small.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Location and Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Ruth T
Reviews.Content: We wouldn't stay here again. Very unpleasant area (right next to Saint Lazare train station), even quite scary at night, and poorly located for reaching the nicer parts of Paris. Rooms are decently furnished but small and overpriced compared to other Parisian hotels we have stayed in. We are not difficult to please travellers but the very positive reviews of this hotel have completely baffled us, even raised our suspicions. Our advice is stay well away - there are too many nice hotels and areas of Paris to even consider this one.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING gem in Paris! Will ABSOLUTELY return!”
Reviews.Author: LikeABirdThatFlew
Reviews.Content: Hotel Wilson Opera is an amazing find in Paris, and I am so lucky to have used Trip Advisor to find this little gem. I traveled to Paris with my boyfriend (we are both in our mid-twenties) for the Christmas Break, and the hotel could not have been more perfect for a couple traveling together or for someone traveling alone. I have visited numerous cities in Europe, and did not want an old, out dated hotel for my one vacation of the year, and especially feared this in Paris, a city known for small, shabby hotel rooms at sky rocket prices. Wilson Opera is modern, stylish, exceptionally clean, comfortable, and very convenient to the entire city of Paris. Just a short (about 2 blocks if even) walk to the St. Lazare Metro Station, you can easily navigate to any area of Paris within 15-20 minutes. This being said, the hotel is also on a quiet street with no disturbance from the ground below. I was worried about being in Paris during Christmas Eve, when many restaurants are closed, and had emailed the hotel a month in advance to help with a reservation. Yadira was beyond helpful and made an amazing recommendation for a quaint, non-touristy, affordable little restaurant on the Ile-St.Louis, Mon Viel Ami. Do try it! I would advise booking directly through the hotel's website, as we got a 3+ night stay discount and the rates were better there than on any other discount travel site (and I checked everywhere). In the special request box, I requested a balcony and was delighted to open the room door to see our wrap around balcony with a view of the Eiffel tower! We will definitely be returning to Hotel Wilson Opera next time we go to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely & Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Eva B
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in October. It is very convenient because it is a minute walk to a major metro station (St. Lazare) and it has a city bike rental right station outside the front door. The staff is very friendly and the rooms are beautiful. We stayed in room 602 and LOVED it. The room an amazing view of the Eiffel tower from the private balcony and a huge bathroom. We can't wait to go back to Paris and would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay, very helpful staff and a great location”
Reviews.Author: Marcu5
Reviews.Content: Had a great trip to Paris for my birthday with my girlfriend in early January and arrived at the hotel on new years day. Receptionist was waiting for us (not sure of his name, young with glasses) and was very helpful with checking if our room was ready etc. Straight away he said that if we needed any reservations for resteraunts or taxis then we should just ask, and we did take up this offer on a taxi to the Eiffel Tower! Also gave us great recommendations for resteraunts in walking distance. Room was cleaned everyday to a high standard and the hotel in general was very clean and had lovely decoration. While it was a little small, this didnt really bother us as we didnt spend too long in there! Hotel is in a great location, within walking distance to all the major attractions; Eiffel Tower, Louvre, Notre Dame, Arc d'Triomfe and of course, the fantastic shopping! Chose this hotel by reading through reviews on here and it certainly paid off, would definitely return! Two great resteraunts near by: Le Carre and Saint Augustin (I think, both next to each other on street corners)

Reviews.Title: “So glad I found this little gem :0)”
Reviews.Author: thesource
Reviews.Content: First time in Paris so didn't know what to expect...... After reading through lots of reviews I think we made the right choice. We stopped in a superior room with breakfast. Booked direct with the hotel online. 45 - 50 Euro transfer from airport. We stopped on the 5th floor and had a great view of the tower with a balcony. Staff are second to none and are really happy to help in any way. The hotel is very clean and bright and breakfast is fresh and tasty. Fantastic place to stay right next to metro and shops. A must visit in Paris is the "Catacombs" most people in paris don't know about it, but it is in the travel guides and on the web. Also not a good idea to try and cross the road at the Arch de Triomphe, take the subway under the road :0). Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not too shabby”
Reviews.Author: JJLovejoy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for the 2011 Christmas weekend. We scheduled an airport transport, they told us it would be 70 euro, but we could not find the driver. We eventually took a taxi which cost 45 euro including tip. I'm glad we couldn't find our ride because the hotel transportation is a rip off. Unless it's the major high season, I don't think the hotel's pickup service is worth the cost. The rooms are definitely small, but modern and clean. If you're American, or used to a top sheet you should bring your own. The hotel has a duvet covering the bed, and it's just not the same without that top sheet. Also the beds are extremely firm. The breakfast was pretty good. Cold cuts, cheese, fresh fruit, yogurt, juice, coffee and plenty of breads! And the free wi-fi is a definite plus.

Reviews.Title: “Small, but more than comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Peter C
Reviews.Content: We visited Paris for the first time and booked a superior room for 4 nights at WO based on reviews from TripAdvisor. We weren't disappointed. As expected the rooms were small, but considering we spent most of our time sightseeing, this was no 'big' deal. The hotel was right next to a major train station, close to several eateries and a short stroll to the Opera and nearby shops. The room was very clean and had a nice balcony to enjoy the morning air. We weren't a big fan of the security measures when you leave the hotel for the day - front desk ask for your room key to hold on to but didn't check your ID when you returned and asked for the key. Fine if they know your face already, but I would have liked an ID-check to confirm you are actually staying at the hotel before handing over a room key. Friendly staff capped off an enjoyable stay for us in Paris. Can highly recommend and will definitely stay again when we return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: ““An Immaculate Hotel in the Sin City””
Reviews.Author: Konstantin_Pap
Reviews.Content: We visited Paris for the first time on the 2nd of January in 2012. For our three nights stay, we booked Hotel Wilson Opera (Hotel WO), following excellent recommendations from friends and work colleagues. A quick Internet search on hotel’s reviews before finalising our reservation increased our expectations for a superb and pleasant stay. Indeed, we were not disappointed at any point. To start with, Hotel WO is ideally situated in the 8th arrondissement, a central business area in the heart of Paris. It is easily accessible from the St Lazare train station, plus next to bus stops and all public transportation. It is close to the Garnier Opera, a few minutes straightforward walk from the posh Galeries Lafayette and Printemps stores, near La Madeleine Church, next to many restaurants, cafes, patisseries and theaters. Within walking distance there are supermarkets, pharmacies, bakeries, banks and post office. Prior to our booking, we have been deeply impressed by the fact that the hotel’s manager professionally and promptly responded all our emails. On the arrival, the staff at the reception was very helpful, polite and informative, providing city maps with all the Paris sightseeings. All of them are fluent English speakers, smiley at all times and very patient with our queries. To our surprise, we managed to receive a generous upgrade to a superior room on the 5th floor with balcony and romantic view of the Eiffel Tower. Especially at night, the illuminated Tower offered an outstanding scenic view. The room was sufficiently spacious, very clean and comfortable. The walls were beautifully decorated with pictures from the Louvre museum, which adds to the overall warm atmosphere. We had courtesy free coffee and tea, flat screen TV, safety box, minibar and complementary high speed Internet connection. The quality of the modern, stylish and cozy furniture was very high and definitely more than satisfactory. Moreover, the colorful lobby offers free newspapers, magazines, a small library, plus Internet access with printing facilities (very helpful for printing maps, last minute things-to-do list and boarding pass). The air-condition was remarkably quiet, fairly important, as it had to run all night long in the cold winter Paris. The bathroom was tidy and spotless with facilities including shower, hair dryer and towel warmer. Shampoo and toiletry amenities were provided on daily basis. We did not notice any street noise. Finally, we appreciated the fact that we were allowed to securely leave our luggage at the hotel after our checking out, in order to enjoy a last romantic stroll in the town free of carrying extra weight. We didn’t have the change to try the buffet breakfast, so no comment on that. To sum up, the flawless Hotel WO contributed greatly to our amazing trip to the City of Light. I cannot overemphasise the importance of an indulging accommodation at a memorable journey; therefore we are pleased for selecting Hotel WO. I would highly recommend it to everyone who is looking for an affordable, excellent value for money, yet superior hosting and romantic stay in France. We will definitely return to Paris and we will be more than willing to stay at the same superb hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Spotlessly Clean”
Reviews.Author: ziggyperth
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very close to ST Lazare Train Station. Up on arrival we had a most warm greeting by one of the lovely staff members. The room is very small but cannot be faulted in any other way. We had a balcony view and could see the Eiffle Tower. This made it fantasitic. The batheroom shower head was always pointed to the floor so when you turned it on the whole area got wet. But this was only a small complaint. The Breakfast down stairs was a bit over priced but the fruit was so fresh. We had free WIFI and coffee and tea as much as we wanted. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: fr3houston
Reviews.Content: The service was absolutely outstanding. We received exceptional service from whoever was at the front desk, the entire team is professional, friendly and extremely helpful. The room and hotel were extremely clean as well, with nice decor. The room was a bit small but this did not bother us at all. The location was good enough, considering the extremely reasonable rate and great service. It was close to a metro station, was pretty safe at night, and was located between the Arc de tromph and Louvre area. I would skip the breakfast and the room service, as there are plenty if cheaper options with better food,but the hotel itself was perfect for us.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: missvanwyck
Reviews.Content: Pre-xmas shopping trip, so the location is great (5 minutes from the fabulous Galeries Lafayette) but far enough away from the noise and bustle. It is a tiny hotel - only a couple of chairs in the foyer, and the rooms are tiny too (although we had a very sweet balcony with great views) but very comfortable and cosy. Staff very attentive and friendly. Great breakfast - the freshest bread and mignardises on a Sunday. Not the cheapest, but overall very good value. Will certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “A litlle Gem in Paris”
Reviews.Author: henry_lawson
Reviews.Content: A very modern and very clean hotel. i stayed here for 1 night and would recomend anyone looking for a small boutique hotel to come here. The bed was really confortable , the room very clean and modern. The staff very friendly (rare in paris ) and very helpfull (also rare in Paris). the location is great , very central and easy access by public or private transport. Breafast was extremely good with the perfect french touch. if you get the chance to stay in pris try this hotel, you wont be disapointed

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with free wifi”
Reviews.Author: whatisben
Reviews.Content: This was a very good hotel to stay at for two nervous travellers. The staff at this hotel were very friendly and eager to help and the free wifi was a nice bonus when looking to wind down after a long day of sight seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need at a Great Price”
Reviews.Author: ian s
Reviews.Content: This new and modern hotel provides exceptional service and quality at an affordable price. When we arrived, the front desk person was extremely helpful and offered us coffee while our room was cleaned. Based on some travel advisor reviews, I requested a room with a balcony and given the great weather, I was glad I did. You should note that only rooms on the 5th and 6th floor have this feature. The hotel is approximately 20 - 25 minute walk from most of the major attractions (Louvre, Notre Dame, etc.) and there are subway lines right beside the hotel. The rooms are standard size for a hotel of this category (small) but very well maintained and comfortable. The breakfast is amazing and well worth 13 Euros. The selection is small but they focus on quality rather than quantity. Finally, the service was great. When we left, there was some confusion regarding a breakfast promotion but the hotel resolved this in our favor. This was greatly appreciated and really was a cut above what I have experienced in other much more expensive Paris hotels. I would highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Magdalena W
Reviews.Content: very good hotel with the best houskeeping, stuf, great breakfest, very nice and clean room :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Flav14
Reviews.Content: Perfect stay! We booked the WO for our 9 night Parisian vacation after reading the reviews on TripAdvisor. I must say that it exceeded our expectations. Our room was of good size, considering European standards. I had a lot of luggage and was able to fit everything with plenty of room to move around. The room came with a nice closet so we could unpack our belongings. The bed was comfortable and clean as well as the bathroom - the towel warmer is a real nice touch. This is a new hotel so everything is nice, clean and new. Unlike some other places I've stayed in Europe. The room was cleaned very nicely every day and coffee and tea was provided, another nice touch. We stayed on the first floor and did not mind the street noise - I am a heavy sleeper though. However, what made our stay even more memorable was the staff. Everyone was extremely helpful and speaking English (or Spanish or Portuguese) was not a problem. Everyday before leaving the hotel we would ask the front desk for directions and recommendations and were always helped with a smile. They even helped us make reservations for dinners and shows. The location was great as well. Right across the street from the metro station and a 10 minute walk to Galeries Lafayette and Champs Elysee s. I would certainly recommend this hotel and will most certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Worth a visit”
Reviews.Author: Stine F
Reviews.Content: We just came back to Denmark, after 3 nights in Paris, for our honeymoon, staying at the Hotel Wo. Working in the tourist/hotel business myself, I'm always quite fussy about my hotels, but I'm amazed about this rather small, but just lovely hotel. Staff was very warm, helpful and spoke very nice english. Breakfast was lovely with typically French things and also with some healthy selections. The room was a little small, but extremely well organized. (I guess size is a problem for all hotels in Paris)The size was never a problem for us, and everything was well functional, and very clean and neat, and made up everyday. Bathroom with a tub and very nice products:-) The hotel has almost no noise from the street or other rooms, with gives great seep:-) Situated just next to the Gare st.lazare station, we would go everywhere in no time! Even by foot, this hotel is close to many of the sights of Paris! Next time, we are diffidently going to stay at Hotel Wo again!!! Thanks for making our stay in Paris, easy, nice, warm and without any kind of problems:-)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelzmarc
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in Paris. It is a great hotel. The staff are friendly and very helping. They assisted with helping us make dinner reservations at restaurants that I wanted to eat at. The entire staff was always cheerful and friendly. The room size was small, but fit the standard Parisian size. Our room was made everyday to perfection. The location of the hotel is just minutes from the Saint Lazare RER and Metro station. This was a huge PLUS and very useful as we used the Metro to travel to all our destinations. The major department stores Printemps and Gallery Lafeyette are about a 10 minute or so walk. This is a perfect boutique hotel for anyone that wants a nice stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Rapster
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the WO for 3 nights for a city break with another couple. The location was great and we managed to walk miles in various directions to see as much as possible of the sights. The staff were excellent and nothing was too much trouble for them. There was a point when we thought our flight might be cancelled due to a strike and they were more than happy to phone the airline for us and then re-checked again the following morning to make sure they had the latest information. The bedroom was small but very well furnished - we didn't spend long in it due to sight-seeing so that was perfect for us. Bathroom had good quality toiletries and everything was very clean. If you stay here make sure you go to see Gallery Lafayette and then just along the road is Printemps store - take the escalators to the top floor and you will find an excellent roof-top cafe which has a brilliant view of the Eiffel Tower - if you can go in the dusk/dark just as the tower lights up - brilliant!

Reviews.Title: “As good as it gets.”
Reviews.Author: Eddie and Judi P
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the WO for 3 nights.. The room was on the small side compared to other places we have stayed in other countries.The double bed was small for what we are used to and was also harder than what we are used to,( that is only a personal preference) The bathroom was a good size and stocked with good quality bathroom products .Excellent staff and a perfect location for any traveller visiting Paris. A short distance to public transport and the Hop On bus route. Overall a Very Good hotel , we will stay at this Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, nicely situated, warm welcome, perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: cinzia.sole
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hotel WO for business reasons and I was very happy with it. The hotel is less than 5 mins away from Gare St Lazare and ten mins to Opera, which is really very well connected and easy if you arrive from CDG with Roissy Bus. The Hotel is small, but very clean, with very nice rooms and bathrooms. The size of room and bathroom were aligned to Parisian standards (not too big, not too small). The room smelt nicely and was correctly heated. Wifi was for free. Very nice bath mignons. I had a nice Nescafé coffee when arrived in my room and a Verveine Tisane before going to bed. Very nice. Staff people were very smart and helpful. Breakfast in the morning was very nice too, with fresh bread and croissants and rolls, fruit salad, yogurt of every kind, Nespresso coffee, jams cereals, hams cheeses, fruit juices...Perfect! I had the best stay, If possible I might come again.

Reviews.Title: “Great find, wonderful service!”
Reviews.Author: aliwally
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a 3-night trip to Paris, staying at Hotel WO. We took a taxi from Gard du Nord where we arrived via Eurostar - outside was stylish and a clean street. Someone greeted us from the taxi and took our bags inside, and check-in was swift. The elevator was out of order, so we were put on the 1st floor - and they even took the bags up for us. The room is exactly as the pictures show - spotless! Great location too - we find it easy to navigage subway, metro, tube systems, so it was really easy to get around Paris. Outstanding service from Vivien who works the desk on the weekends - he's a MBA student at the Sorbonne - and I'm sure will go on to have a great career in the hospitality industry - he went above and beyond. Same for the great staff who cleaned our room and worked in the breakfast room - super friendly and eager to help. And when we checked out and I had to remind them that my reservation included breakfast...they quickly checked their records and adjusted the bill - perfect service. My company's Paris office is very close by, and I shall be back to stay at this neighborhood hotel when I come back on business trips.

Reviews.Title: “Small Room But Very Nice & Clean”
Reviews.Author: Chrisghu
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights. The hotel is very near to metro and train station. Within 5 to 10mins walk to Opera house; 2 department stores: Printemps and Galeries Lafayette. One of the part time staff: Vivie, he is very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: Steve D
Reviews.Content: First off, let me say that my girlfriend is scary. She is beautiful and Russian and demanding and scary. So, when I have to choose the hotel we are going to stay in, my very happiness and well-being relies on me making the right selection, or I will never hear the end of it. I am extremely glad I chose the Hotel WO, it is very well located, the staff were accommodating and friendly, the room was modern and spotless - it was just a thoroughly pleasant stay. And, maybe more importantly, my relationship remained intact for the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: tina b
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel for daughters 16th birthday for two nights. In good central location beside st lazera train station. Rooms were spotless but small, however upgraded daughters to room 503 which was slightly bigger with balcony and view of tower. Short walk to bars and and shops .galleries lafeyette beautiful, had a wonderful weekend and would stay at this hotel again and would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location near Train Stations and Opera”
Reviews.Author: gordi00728
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a modern up beat hotel near The Lazare Train Station. However, you cannot hear any trains at night. Also, do not worry about seedy people hanging around train station areas. There are lots of people / tourists walking about late at night. Location is also near 2 Metro stations "Europe and Lazare". Both can get you where you need to go very fast. Staff spoke good English and were very helpful with our room. It was ready right away. Very clean rooms with a safe and good WI-FI. We were hardly in our room but we slept good for the most part. Our last night there was some noise on our floor as people kept opening and closing their doors. But I did not notice the walls being very thin. They called cabs for us which arrived on time. Gard de Nord is within 10 minutes cab ride if you take a train out or in. Overall it was a nice boutique hotel with all the amenities you need.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel with fantasitic staff”
Reviews.Author: Joanne O
Reviews.Content: I stayed 5 nights at the Hotel WO and just loved it. The staff are so friendly and helpful, the location is central and easy to get to, the breakfast was delicious and the room extremely clean and cute. I had a wonderful time and would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very common "Small Room" in Europe”
Reviews.Author: Viana W
Reviews.Content: Oct, 15 to Oc. 18,2011 we were at Hotel Wo. We like it very much because the location is just 5 minutes from Galeries Lafayette. Especially, if you like to go shopping. This the place you should stay. The room is very modern,nice, clean and bright. The breakfast is also nice for 13 Euro. Too bad the second night that we stayed the alarm went off three times. My husband could not go back to bed right away. The part time receptionist Vivien is very kind, helpful. We hope to go back to the same hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Paris at home”
Reviews.Author: tchinha
Reviews.Content: Great place, I was here in a suprise trip to my cousin...we were 8 and it was great. Samll hotel but with really nice interior design. Very nice staff and in a convenient area in central Paris the rooms are small but enough for a short trip the breakfast is also good

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: craigwatson
Reviews.Content: Stayed here this weekend and enjoyed our stay. Great location just minutes away from one of the main Metro stations, St Lazare, but you wouldnt know it as no noise from the station. The room was small (we were in 302), as was the showerroom. Cant fault the staff, very helpfull and attentive. Booked us a restaurant on Saturday and it was 1st class. Free WIFI was hit or miss but this was down to the system being upgraded so cant fault that. Breakfast good, continental style but you are in Paris so loads of places to eat. Pro's : Room specifications, showers, staff, location Con's : Room size Biggest problem was the 3 time the fire alarm went off in the early hours of 1 morning BUT that, we believe, was down to residents in another room, so NO fault of the hotel. Would we return YES, although we would take the hit and book one of the bigger rooms next time.

Reviews.Title: “friendly/comfortable/location”
Reviews.Author: RONNIE9096
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent a week at this lovely hotel,and enjoyed the very friendly attention of Sebastion and Yadira. The hotel is very well appointed spotlessly clean and all the staff helpful, the breakfast is great ,and the location is all you could want,we have been to Paris nearly every year over the past 20 years and have stayed in varied hotels and apartments,in future we will most definately return and stay at Wilson Opera. My Daughter Joanne also stayed 5 days and we caught up the last day for a Parisian dinner at the Hotel Crillon, she also asked us to mention how very satisfied with W/O and will be returning Ron and Margaret OBryan

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay and Experience”
Reviews.Author: bob t
Reviews.Content: Travel extensively around the USA, and compare the WO with the very best for comfort and value with anything in America. Want to thank the owner, Sebestien(looks like French movie star), and especially Vivien and Yadira for their guidance and recommendation. Location of Gare St. Lazare was ideal, and wonderful shopping and cafes right in the neighborhood..Recommend without reservation and will return next year! Robert Troy

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: specialk23
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in about 20 hotels in this area as I visit at least twice a year. This is one of the best in it's class. Great location. Massive bathroom (for Paris). Modern fitout. Lots of boulangeiries and supermarkets nearby. Really couldn't fault it. Will be back. Only thing was I was ripped off a little because I asked them to book a taxi to gare du Nord (approx 10 Euro). But I was booked a private car without being told in advance which had a fixed rate of 30 Euro. Not much I could do because it was eraly in the morning and I had to catch my train. But I was disappointed

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern and comfortable with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: LMW_11
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent value. We stayed here for 10 days in a superior room. The staff were very friendly and helpful, the room was clean and very comfortable. There are Metro stations and Gare Saint Lazare within a 2 minute walk making this hotel a great place to be based to explore all of Paris. There are also cafes, bistros and restaurants and shops very close by and it is in a quiet, safe area. The free Internet access was really convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: auzigirl03
Reviews.Content: I spent months looking for the perfect place to stay for our first trip to Europe and Hotel Wilson Opera was a perfect first stop! A cozy, modern, boutique hotel in a quiet neighborhood was just what we were looking for. All the staff we met were very helpful and incredibly kind. Our room was very clean and after reading all the reviews on Trip Advisor - I was worried about the size of our room but surprised to find how spacious it was. We were on the top floor in 602 with the balcony looking out towards the Eiffel Tower which was absolutely perfect. Proximity to Saint Lazare station made the location perfect - we bought a 10 pack of tickets at the station and used the Metro everyday. We found breakfast to be a little pricey at the hotel - so we found a perfect pastry shop just 2 streets away and ate breakfast there everyday. Overall, we loved our stay at Hotel Wilson Opera and we will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Clean, Friendly and Good Location”
Reviews.Author: johnsmmed
Reviews.Content: My wife and I picked the WO based on TA reviews and location. We spent 7 nights from 9/24 to 10/1/2011. We were not disappointed. We booked a superior room with a queen bed. We stayed in 505 which we were pleasently suprised to find had a nice balcony. We could see the top 1/3 of the Eiffel tower from it. Bed was comfortable. Flat screen TV was nice. Only CNN was in English but we didn't come to Paris to watch TV. Th AC worked very well which was good because it was unusually warm last week. The wifi worked great. We used it to skype the kids back home each night. The rooms are small but we expected that. Bathrooms are fine and ours had a towel warmer. There is an in room safe that fit our I-pad but don't know if it would fit a laptop, netbook maybe. There is a mini bar fridge in the room. It is quite small but we asked if we could put our own wine in it. They said not a problem, put whatever you want in it. We could wedge in 2 bottles it we juggled things around. The elevator broke down twice during the week but was repaired quickly. Location is great, near Gare St. Lazare. From airport CDG take RER B to Gare Nord then change to RER E to Haussman-St Lazare. The stations are well marked. Make sure you are going in the right direction. Tickets sold at same window as metro tickes. Cost is E9.10. You will have to schlepp your luggage up and down some steps though. If that's a problem, take a taxi. There is also the Europe metro stop very close by, up the hill off of Rue de Rome. We used it coming back at night to avoid walking up hill from St. Lazare. There is a market on your way to St Lazare that has fresh bread and pain au chocolate, as well as wine, cheese and other picnic items. Department stores are an easy walk as is L'Olympia theatre. We saw Jimmy Buffet there on Monday. We never felt unsafe walking around at night. I can't say enough good things about the staff. They really make the place all that much nicer to stay at. Yadira and Vivien were especially friendly and very helpful. We would highly recommend the WO, and look forward to staying there the next time we come to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: Limden
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights here and it was a brilliant stay,nice clean modern hotel with very helpful staff.not in a dangerous area like some people have said,ideally located to see all the sights!!!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: Lorraine N
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Wo Hotel. We were greeted by a very helpful staff, that spoke perfect English. Our room was excellent and the breakfast buffet was delightful. We have stayed in many places in Paris at double the price and none compare to the quality of the hotel and the kindness of the staff. Thanks for making our stay in Paris so enjoyable. Also very convenient location and easy to get to.

Reviews.Title: “Only one night”
Reviews.Author: veentia
Reviews.Content: Paris was at the end of our trip only for one night, I had checked out hotels that would be close to Printemps and Galeries Lafayette through Trip Advisor and selected Hotel WO which was a good priced for Paris, a just a few blocks from the department stores. We arived at 10AM our room was ready and the desk clerk mapped out a walk to the Grand Palais which was great. Hotel room was small but modern and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Just What We Expected”
Reviews.Author: Tango070
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and the couple traveling with us arrived at the Hotel WO at mid-morning hoping for an early check-in. We were informed that our luggage could be stored immediately and that rooms would be available in a short while. Our fellow travelers were accommodated after a few minutes wait but our wait turned out to be almost an hour. As we sat and squirmed in the lobby we feared that this development could be an omen of events to come. We were pleasantly surprised and constantly reminded during our six-night stay at the Hotel WO that we had indeed made a wise choice. We were given a room upgrade that looked out over a very interesting and diverse Parisian intersection that included a bakery, a brasserie, an ATM and provided unending people watching opportunities. Our room was fairly large by European standards with a very comfortable queen bed and adequate storage. The toilet-shower-basin combo, with no bathtub, was clean and functional with a curtain for additional privacy. Everything was well-maintained and worked properly. The air conditioning worked flawlessly, somewhat of a surprise given what I had read about Parisian boutique hotels, and noise was never a problem. Hotel attendents / receptionists are top-notch. They are all fluent in English and are knowledgeable about almost anything essential regarding city venues and transportation. All of them take a hands-on approach in solving any problem that arises to insure that guests are satisfied. They were particularly helpful in securing taxis in a timely manner and giving reliable estimates for travel by metro (subway) or taxi to any number of tourist sites and eating places throughout the city. Within a short walk of the hotel is the largest metro station in Paris (Gare St.-Lazare), which contains connections for four metro lines and several RER (suburban) trains. Also within reasonable walking distance is a Starbucks, two food markets (one is actually a supermarket), several restaurants and the Galleries Lafayette shopping complex for real power (albeit expensive) shopping. Though the hotel serves breakfast on the lower level we always opted to eat at one of the neighborhood brasseries or cafes each morning. Not only were the prices better but an early morning walk in the area made for an energizing start to the day. For value, location and quality of staff the Hotel Wilson Opera is hard to beat, offers a great experience in a world class city and is the perfect place to enjoy all the city has to offer. We will definitely stay at the Hotel Wilson Opera on our next visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in convenient area”
Reviews.Author: Chris1612
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. We stayed in a superior room and got a good deal from hotels.com. The staff were very knowledgeable and friendly, especially Yarid, who helped us with metro routes for our itinery for the seven days. Breakfast is extra and there is a breakfast buffet at 13 Euros, but we bought great fresh baked pastries and juice from a supermarket opposite Gare St.Lazare metro station three mins. away. The room was small, but has good quality fixtures, comfortable beds and always kept clean. A taxi from Gare du Nord will cost 15 euros outside of rush hour, and 20 euros in rush hour. We were very impressed with the quiet air conditioning which we left on all day and kept the room fresh.

Reviews.Title: “good stay”
Reviews.Author: nurit
Reviews.Content: in this very friendly hotel you can find clean and comfortable rooms. the rooms are very small but well designed. the front desk stuff where very nice, helpfull and kind. even though the outside surrounding is not super beautiful the location is good enough to explore the city. metro is not too far and there r few points of interest in near by area which you can reach by foot. i had stayed one night in paris and was happy with my choice.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly Enjoyed My Stay!”
Reviews.Author: travel_junkie3000
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice, boutique hotel in a great location. I was in Paris for work and had to commute to Colombes/La Defense area daily. The Gare St. Lazare is less than 2 blocks from the hotel and gets you to the La Garenne Colombes station in about 10 minutes. Trains ran frequently throughout the day. There are also restaurants, cafes, and brasseries nearby, plus a supermarket and pharmacy around the corner. Getting to other attractions and parts of Paris from here is also a breeze either by rail or nice, leisurely walks. The rooms are the usual size for Paris, small by American standards, but well appointed with everything you need. Plus a balcony overlooking the streets of Paris - what more could you want? The bed and pillows were comfortable, the rooms are air conditioned, there is a flatscreen (with mostly French stations and CNN, what surprised me was that there was no BBC?). There is also room for a desk and the wifi connection (included in the cost of the hotel) was fast even way up on the 5th floor. Breakfast at the hotel was an additional 9 Euros (Meats, cheeses, yogurt, breads, coffee, cereal, juices), and was sufficient if you have no other option. Drycleaning service is available with same day turnaround. The staff at the hotel was very friendly, helpful, and accomodating. A big thank you to the front desk staff this morning, that tried very diligently to help me find a cab to the airport. If you are flying out of Paris in the morning I'd recommend booking your cab the evening before. If you'd like to take the train to CDG - allow an hour, especially if you have large luggage to manuever. There are a lot of steps and much walking when you are transfering between trains. It's not difficult, but you will need a fairly portable bag that you can lift easily. Directions to CDG from Hotel Wilson: Gare St. Lazare > RER E toward Chelles or Villiers Change at Magenta > follow directions to the Gare du Nord Gare du Nord > RER B toward Charles De Gaulle terminal 1 or 2 I would definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, affordable and great location”
Reviews.Author: JDC_007
Reviews.Content: I'm a heavy business traveler, and would stay again in an instant. Great opera location, value for money was amazing, and I enjoyed the boutique feel. Place was clean, wireless internet included in the rate. Rooms aren't huge and the optional continental breakfast isn't special, but those aren't things I consider when looking for a hotel room. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Convenient boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: tinybell
Reviews.Content: Hotel WO is exactly how it looks in the picture found in websites. Its clean, new and very beautiful small hotel that is very near (3min walk) to a big metro station (St. Lazare). There are supermarkets, eateries and shopping(printemps, gallery lafayette) mall nearby too, very convenient. One thing that needs improvement is the shower screen panel; water gets splash out of the shower/tub area easily making the toilet floor very wet after the first person had a bath. Overall, i had a very pleasant stay at WO, highly recommended for short city stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel with friendly service and great rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Anon7643
Reviews.Content: Hotel WO is exactly how it looks in the pictures- spacious, clean, modern and welcoming. We paid around $170au p/night which we found good value given the room size and location. The hotel is only a couple minutes walk to the Gare Saint Lazare train station and is a 15 minute walk to the Airport bus stop (to Charles de Gaulle $10 euros)  The hotel staff all speak English fluently and are efficient in responding to any email queries prior to arrival. One of the reception girls also recommended the most delicious crepe cafe which was not in a touristy area (cannot recall the name, but be sure to ask) Hotel WO also asks guests to leave the key w reception when you go out, at first we were a little apprehensive but have since found that a few other European hotels do this. Approx costs of taxis in Euros: From Eurostar train station $15 From Eiffel Tower $10-15 Overall we would strongly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Superb stylish gem!”
Reviews.Author: elephz
Reviews.Content: New boutique hotel, very convenient location near metro, shopping and seine. Rooms were very clean, large bathroom with modern fun decor and all necessary amenities including flat screen tv and wifi. Our room had a balcony with nice view. Owner is super friendly and accessible. Great service! We highly recommend this gem!

Reviews.Title: “Short but very nice stay!”
Reviews.Author: Karo K
Reviews.Content: Short but very nice stay. I’m from Norway & came to discover Paris with my husband from the UK. Extremely neat, recently refurbished, practical room - modern feel & look Free wifi, computer, newspaper and nice flat screen TV with cable in room Nice breakfast with croissant, juice, and everything you wish for an authentic & great French breakfast All staff is very friendly and helpful, they recomanded us what to do & where to eat 1 block from one of the main train/metro station (St. Lazare) where all metros are connected without any inconvenience or noise Very close to bakeries, cinema, super markets, etc. We real enjoyed our stay & highly recomand it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel near to everything!”
Reviews.Author: Catw25
Reviews.Content: Had a fab stay. Hotel is very clean. Rooms are small but have everything u need. Plus your in Paris so u are not going to be in your room long. Location is great, near to station and restaurants. All in all was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Super little hotel - Very clean and very quiet”
Reviews.Author: Susanna02
Reviews.Content: Lovely little hotel and would definitely stay again. Spotlessly clean, great mattresses, free wi-fi and very quiet. It would have helped to know beforehand that the closest Metro was St Augustin - we spent far too long trying to find the hotel from St Lazare Hausemann on the E line - it was all very confusing which exit to use. Much easier from St Lazare metro or St Augustin. Good little supermarket close by, although limited restaurants really close by.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: tcray70
Reviews.Content: Wonderful and friendly staff willing to assist with all needs. Travel information was very helpful and staff spoke English very well. Also room was clean and in great shape the rooms are rather small but it is expected in Europe. So no wasted room here but everything you need. Will be looking forward to staying here again. AC and wireless was a wonder.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury little design hotel with good staff in Paris centre”
Reviews.Author: DenizOzen
Reviews.Content: One of the better hotels in Paris, I would think. Pricey, but we had a discount and paid 145,- p/n for a Classic room and that made it very worth it. Staff here gives you personal attention and good advice, unlike bigger hotels where you re just a number. Luxurious design, good strong waterbeam from a lovely rain shower, good bed, very helpful staff. Clean and comfortable. Yes rooms are small, but what do you expect in Paris? Breakfast is pricey but it's Paris and have to say it was definetly worth it, everyhting is fresh and there's a lot of choice. The hotel is located in a side street of the upper class neigboorhood Rue de Rome (centre) and walking distance of Boulevard Hausmann (shopping) and Gare st Lazare so everyhting is within easy and fast reach. Bistro le Carre at Place St Augustin servers wonderful and subtle food with good service and a nice terrace outside. We loved our stay and when we come back to Paris, this is where we'll be staying.

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfectly-formed Parisian base”
Reviews.Author: Pollyanna P
Reviews.Content: On a quiet street within a main, busy district of Paris, seconds away from main public transport links in the form of the St Lazare station... I was not expecting to discover such a gem, so central and so reasonably priced. Comfy bed, great shower, clean room and ensuite and friendly, helpful staff 24-hours a day. This was my first (fleeting, 3-day-) trip to Paris. I will be back to the city for sure and would definitely go back to WO! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: jamesfarrar
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice now. This is a great boutique hotel. Ideal location for business, free wifi and very comfortable and well equiped rooms though smaller than standard hotel rooms. Good central location near Gare St Lazarre. Good value for money.Very clean and well maintained. Good breakfast.. No bar or restaurant though. What really stands out is the service - on both occassions staff were personally very helpful with some assistance I needed due to schedule complications. Great hotel for business or private visits. Ideal if you like something a litte more personal than a big htoel but still expect high standards.

Reviews.Title: “great to see so many honest positive reports of this hotel-book it!”
Reviews.Author: whittak
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 4 nights and we have no negative things to say at all.Why do so many people want a palacial room when they are visiting one of the world's leading cities? The location is first class with so many metro lines moments from the front door.Ignore whatever you have read aboiut the reception staff unless it is positive-they were all friendly ,helpful and professional.Visit the Auberge du Clour restaurant in Monmartre.Only two mininutes from the Pigalle metro stop.Lovely small friendly bistro which the reception staff recommended.If you just want a good pizza after a long day out then walk to Pompeii only 5 mins away.We would return anytime and would recommend it to anyone.My wife and I are fortunate to be able to take a number of holidays each year and this is a great hotel for the price and location.The positve reviews of the breakfasts are also truee and will set you up very well for the day.Ignore the negative reviews.Book with confidence!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern, pleasant, tiny”
Reviews.Author: neeka82
Reviews.Content: I fell in love with the purple couch pictured on their site and had to stay there. When we arrived for our 9 night stay, the front desk clerk (Yesidra?) informed us we had been upgraded to a larger room since we were there for so long. Our room on the top floor was chic but odd shaped with the slanted roof and was definately smaller than any other room I have stayed in, even in Europe. It was very clean and the bed was comfy. Bathroom also was spotless, and I'm a bit of a germ freak so that matters. When we arrived, the smell of cleaning product was overwhelming but after an hour of the windows open, we were fine (and at least I knew it was clean). The location was ok- very close to shopping on Haussmen but everything else we had to take the Metro, with the station directly across the street. Not a lot of close by dining options that we enjoyed. Yesidra the front desk clerk was by far the best with suggestions, maps, and reccomendations. The others at the front desk were less helpful, especially on a Sunday when we hadn't realized EVERYTHING would be closed and we had nothing to eat and she couldn't really direct us anywhere. Our room was very quiet, which was great. Stop at the market or nearby little corner stores to pick up cheap snacks and water. That's pretty much the only reasonably priced stuff we found in all of Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Very Cosy, Very Friendly”
Reviews.Author: jwp118
Reviews.Content: This was a very cosy spot for us, which acted as a one night stop between arriving in Paris and joining our Euro tour. If we were staying in Paris longer on our own, we would have been perfectly happy at Hotel Wilson Opera. The staff were some of friendly and most helpful people we had ever met. An excellent introduction for us to Europe and especially to Paris. Location wise, it is located very close to the heart of Parisian shopping and a major Metro / train station. Plenty of great places to eat very close by. It was no problem at all for us to leave our bags with the staff while we explored after check out and no problem at all for us to sit around surfing the internet in their lobby while we waited for our next pickup. Free WiFi was very helpful and appreciated as well (I don't think this was advertised)

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: FormosaRT
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for two nights at the end of July. Booked on Expedia for a fair rate based on the location and the reviews. We were pleasantly surprised, and thought it was a great hotel for our quick Parisian getaway. Upon check-in, we were welcomed with an upgrade to room 602, it had a large balcony and a great view of the city. The room was small (expected) but quite comfortable. Most of all, we found the staff to be very friendly and helpful with a great command of English (especially Yadira, who greeted us daily with a friendly smile). Being very close to the trains (St. Lazare stn), great shopping at Gallerie Lafayette, and Opera (pick up point for the city bus tours) made it easily accessible to get around the city. Neither my boyfriend or I ever take the time to write reviews, but truly thought that the choice of hotel was a big addition to our trip: affordable, enjoyable and well-situated!

Reviews.Title: “great value and exellent place”
Reviews.Author: dynaformer
Reviews.Content: we stayed ib the hotel WO with our young family staff was good with the kids and the room are nice. fresh breakfast and great location.

Reviews.Title: “I would rather sleep on a bench than go back to this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: sue186358
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a rather bleak location and the male receptionist was indifferent and rude when we arrived. However, the rooms were very nice, well designed and clean although far too small for 2 people sharing. We were concerned when our key cards failed to work on our second day and we had to have them replaced. There was no explanation or apology. Eventually, the rude receptionist was replaced by a nice one - however, five days later when we asked for an early morning call and an 7 am taxi to take us to the airport, my sister got two calls and my husband and I got none. It was pure luck that we woke up in time - we could so easily have missed our flight. We arrived in reception just before 7 am to find that the taxi was already waiting, presumably because it had been booked too early, which may explain why the fare was extortionate. As we left the hotel we were charged 13 euro's for drinks, that we had not had, from the mini bar. The receptionist eventually agreed that he had made a mistake and so charged us instead ,13 euro's for eating some crisps which were on the tray with the complimentary tea and coffee.When we commented that we had not received an early morning call he more or less told us we were lying. It was a very unpleasant experience.I would rather sleep on a bench than go back to this hotel. In the end it's how good the staff are that makes the most difference to a hotel's reputation.

Reviews.Title: “Spoiled trip by their personnel”
Reviews.Author: JoKimball
Reviews.Content: While the hotel is relatively convenient (2 blocks from St. Lazare Metro) and clean, with small rooms, the desk clerk ruined our stay. The hotel is locked at night and the clerk is supposed to be at the desk to let you in or answer calls from your room. My husband was left standing outside for some time with no clerk in sight. When we tried to place a call for wakeup no one answered the phone. At checkout we were told by this clerk that we had not paid when in fact we had sent a bank draft (acknowledged by them at the time) to cover the entire amount many, many months ahead. When we showed him the paperwork he refused to take it. Would not recommend this hotel. Never got the wakeup call.

Reviews.Title: “Great little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CanaDuc
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel WO for 4 nights...this is a great little hotel, very nicely kept and clean. The rooms were very small, but I was a solo traveller so space wasn't an issue and I had a huge balcony from which I could see the Eiffel Tower in the distance. If you chosen method of transportation is Metro, the location is perfect, only a minutes walk from the Ste. Lizarre Metro station....I did most of my touring on foot, so the location wasn't perfect (15+ minutes walk to the Champs Elysee) however it was still reasonably central and I had no issues finding my way around from this area. For 13 Euro they served a great little cold continental breakfast each morning which was more than enough to get me going for the day! The service was great and so was the room, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Poor soundproofing and unhelpful staff”
Reviews.Author: JcA13
Reviews.Content: The rooms are nice and modern and I could see how people could love this hotel if you get the right room. Noise: Unfortunately, I was placed in room 102 where the wall next to the bed has the lift on the other side so it is impossible to sleep with the noisy lift constantly going up and down right next to you. You can also hear the people in the room next door and people walking around in the room above. The sound of the water going down the pipes when someone flushes the toilet or has a shower is also quite loud. I have travelled extensively and am not usually too fussy but this is the worst soundproofed hotel I have stayed at. Staff: The girl at reception is useless. I wanted to cancel the remainder of my stay after the first night but she said she didn't know how to help me with that. I asked if I could move to another room, again she said she didn't know how to help with that. Not sure what her purpose is since she cannot help with anything. Credit card details: They will pre-authorize your credit card for the entire cost of the stay during the week before your arrival. On check-in you have to write all your credit card details on a piece of paper for them to keep which is not very secure. The girl doesn't check what you write though so you could just write any numbers. Overall, very disappointed with this hotel. Doesn't live up to the reviews at all. However, as mentioned the rooms are nice so you may enjoy your stay more than I did if you ensure you do not get the room next to the lifts.

Reviews.Title: “TA Phenomenon earns its TopNotch Ratings!”
Reviews.Author: Todd_Gundlach
Reviews.Content: It never ceases to amaze me what people will complain about - slow elevator? TAKE THE STEPS! Small Rooms? Book the Ritz 5 minutes away and pay 8X what you do here! This is an awesome hotel, don't let anyone tell you differently. We booked two rooms (double standards) for four nights well in advance of our early July vacation. Our two teenage daugthers were traveling with us. When we checked in (Nina) informed us of the fact that we were upgraded to superior and were 'Neighbors' - Sweet - we had rooms 205 & 206 each room faced on different streets (NO NOISE AT ALL) of this triangular block in St. Germain (many differing opinions of this area - it is the 8th on the edge of the 17th I think, and about 600 meters from one of the most exclusive neighborhoods in Paris (Parc Monceau). It is even closer to Gare St. Lazare - now - who has been to ANY city in the world near a major train station and didn't think it was busy and a bit gritty? No One - but this area is unique in the fact that it is nearest the train station, but mixed into a very nice residential area and one with commerce and business. Thus it is an EXCELLENT location for your travels). That puts to bed any ideas of a bad location - we were able to travel for five days, four nights on four carnets of metro tickets (50 euro total) - Also you are near the Garnier Opera which has a RoissyBus stop which is direct to DeGaulle Airport (CDG) for 10 Euro. It cost us 18 Euro to take a taxi with 7 large bags to the RoissyBus stop which is literally 1km away - Did anyone mention the shopping on Blvd Hussmann? The most famous shopping plazas there (not the exclusive ones off Champs de L'Eysee) Printemps & Galleries de Layfayette all of which are within 1km of this hotel. While on our visit we were greeted by at least four different desk clerks, none of which had any difficulty with English, so I have no idea where those comments come from, and weeks prior to our stay we used the staff for reservations at local restaurants - or you can make your own at the La Forchette (the fork) website, which is a great resource. We would recommend Au Risi et Bisi - a 5 minute walk up the street for a nice relaxing and incredibly scrumptous Italian Dinner. We walked our arses off in Paris and at times our kids couldn't keep up. When you return for a couple hours rest in the afternoon, there is a Marche (market) just as you approach the hotel that sells everything you might need, and the hotel leaves room in the mini bar fridge to keep your personal drinks cold. Beer, Wine, Liquor, soft drinks, fresh fruit, breads and packaged goods can be purchased here at a fraction of the cost elsewhere in Paris - so use it. Internet problems? I don't think so, we had two ipod touches, an ipad and netbook all working off their WiFi with absolutely no problems and no intervention from the hotel staff - its a bit unfair to blame the hotel on computer issues you might have. Free Wifi is everywhere and if you have a big problem, go down the street to the Starbucks with an upstairs lounge and join all the other Parisians doing business there over thier repas. Relax, enjoy yourself and most definitely stay at this hotel, you will not be dissapoiinted by anything.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, Affordable Hotel for Paris!”
Reviews.Author: StacyTX
Reviews.Content: I just returned from two nights at Hotel WO and I can't say enough nice things about the staff and the property. The hotel is located about 200 yards (give or take) from the St. Lazare metro station (which has stops for at least four different metro lines) and in the midst of restaurants, shops, the all important Starbucks (corner of Haussman Blvd), and banks/ATMs. The staff are very friendly and helpful for whatever you need (and are available 24/7, I think). The rooms are a bit small, but all of the furnishings are very modern, the a/c worked really well, and the bed and shower were top notch. I highly recommend this hotel for anyone traveling on a bit of a budget...you can't do much better!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect part of our honeymoon...”
Reviews.Author: MrsDebnam
Reviews.Content: We've been to Paris twice before and done all the major tourist attractions. We came back for four days on our honeymoon. After not getting off to such a good start by losing my passport within 5 minutes of landing, the trip could have been a disaster. We spent the first night in an airport hotel and the proceeded onto the hotel Wilson Opera the following morning. Upon arriving at the hotel, we were greeted by a really friendly lady with brown curly hair (I really wish we had got her name now). She was more than accommodating and made us feel really welcome. She also told us that the had upgraded our room as we were on our honeymoon (emotions still running high from the wedding, I had to turn away before I cried!!!) The room couldn't have been more clean even if every person that worked there suffered with OCD. It was SPOTLESS!!! Fair enough, it was cosy but this is what I love about the charm of the Parisian buildings. Every facility worked, including the air con! This was particularly welcome as it was ridiculously hot that week. We always use the metro or buses when we go to Paris as we find it the easiest way to get around (and a taxi ride can be rather terrifying!). We had a meal pre-booked at the Eiffel Tower and asked the curly haired lady what was the best way to get there. Rather than just saying "go here, turn right etc", whilst we were out for the day, she printed us off a bus schedule and plan, highlighted which stops to get off and on at and had also taken note that we had spent the day in Monte Marte and planned us a route to get there again! She was so helpful and lovely, I couldn't praise her more. The location is fantastic, the metro, bus stops and taxis are all at the end of the street. We walked to Monte Marte on the first day and it only took ten minutes (and I have small legs!!!!) so anyone that know Paris will understand that it really is very central. Also, getting the bus from the hotel Wilson Opera to the Eiffel Tower takes you done the "Expensive" shopping strip. Being on the bus meant that we couldn't spend - just admire. Overall, it was a beautiful, modern but also romantically charming hotel with the most wonderful, kind and helpful staff and we will definitely be returning in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience & service”
Reviews.Author: BROWMI
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights in late June; the service was fantastic - very welcoming and friendly. Given the length of our stay, the hotel gave us a free upgrade to the largest possible room size. This turned out to be critical, as common in Paris, the room sizes were a bit small. That said, we were able to fit comfortably in the room once settled in. The in-room washrooms were wonderful and the air conditioning worked amazingly well. One small gripe is the lack of a mini-fridge in the room - the unit provided is only for keeping things marginally cold - if you put stuff in assuming it is a regular refrigerator, watch out, as items may spoil. That said, the front desk was helpful and willing to offer space in their refrigerator for smaller items.

Reviews.Title: “Great small and clean hotel, central location”
Reviews.Author: torontotwo_13
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel largely based on the reviews on tripadvisor. We spent a week in the 3rd week of June and were very happy with the choice. The best things include; Very quiet and clean room, firm comfortable queen size mattress, good a/c unit and a 5 minutes walk to St Lazarre metro ( with all of its connections). We walk alot found it an easy walk to the Opera, the Louvre and even Notre Dame. Paris (with a good map) is great to walk in and this central location served us well. As busy as the St Lazarre train station area is, this hotel is tucked away on a quiet street only, so you quickly leave the noise/traffic behind. As noted by others, the reception staff are friendly, and there is a free laptop for guests in the lobby.
