On the more negative side, as others have commented, we found Paris hotel prices generally higher than in other cities and the room was definitely the smallest we've stayed in. The only way to open our suitcases was to put them on the bed, one at a time. We did not take the breakfast at the hotel.. but there are many cafes a short walk away. If you want to consider dinner in areas, restaurants that are less tourist focused, there were many lovely restaurants we went to a short walk from the hotel near Metro Villiers, It was about a 10 min walk from the hotel with a great neighborhood feel. Paris is a wonderful city. This hotel was a great choice for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for quality and price!”
Reviews.Author: waltytraveler
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here a few weeks ago and we both continue to remark how nice this hotel was. The staff were very friendly and helpful and went out of their way to meet our needs. We were surprised to have received an upgrade and we were given the most amazing room with a balcony overlooking St. Augustin church and the Eiffel Tower. We loved enjoying our morning coffee on that balcony. It is conveniently located next to Gare Saint Lazare which has 4 metro lines and it is also only a 15 minute walk to either Arc de Triomphe or the Concorde. The hotel was kept superbly clean and we felt very privileged to stay there. Breakfast is typical European continental breakfast fare with pastries, meats, cheeses, fruit, etc. It was one of the few European hotel breakfasts I've had that left me feeling quite full until late afternoon. We would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone and would stay again here in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “This is a fantastic hotel by Gare St Lazare and the department stores”
Reviews.Author: Jedisson
Reviews.Content: Strongly recommend this hotel right by the Gare St Lazare metro and train station and only 5 minutes walk from the Galleries Layfette and Printemps department stores. There are lots of restaurants and cafes close by. The hotel staff are great and we really enjoyed the breakfast each morning. The hotel rooms are a bit small, although in saying that the bed is comfy, everthing is spotlessly clean, there is a small fridge for the minibar, the Damar toiletries are a v nice touch and it's nice that there are only 30 rooms so it's a quiet haven from the bustle of Paris. We would like to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and cozy”
Reviews.Author: Afinskaya
Reviews.Content: It is nice and cozy hotel. Good locatiion, nearest metro stations are Europe and St. Lazare, also 10 minutes walk to station Opera (many interchanges and connections). Small but nice room. Breakfast was good (13 euro). Staff are frienly and helpfull. Everything was good.))

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: YStraveller
Reviews.Content: After reading many hotel reviews we booked two rooms at the Wilson Opera for our June vacation. We were looking for location and value. We found the hotel very well located closed to St. Lazare station, restaurants and stores. The rooms were small but comfortable and the bathrooms were also new and clean. The staff was very friendly and helpful with suggestions for dining and securing a larger taxi to the airport for our family of four. I would definately recommend Wilson Opera for a stay in Paris. Comparing more expensive options I rather spend the difference enjoying the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: chickenbizkit
Reviews.Content: Hotel WO provided a great stay for us while in Paris. It's close to Saint Lazarre metro/train station which proved to be very convenient when we arrived at Paris Nord from London and when we caught the Artesia night train from Paris Bercy to VSL. We caught an evening train to Venice and they front desk person was more than happy to hold our bags for us after checkout so we could enjoy our last day in Paris without having to worry about where to store our bags. Our room was small, but clean (most important!) and comfortable. The location really was prime for us. Very near to the hotel are a post office for mailing postcards, a little cafe, pharmacy, and a great boulangerie that we visited everyday for our morning croissant/pastries and espresso; although, the hotel does provide a breakfast for an additional cost. As far as restaurants in the area that are open late – it’s slim pickings. We often found ourselves ready for dinner after 10pm and only bars were open so not the best area for evening dining since the metro stops running at around midnight and you feet are too weary to trek back to the hotel. There's also shopping nearby with Galleries Lafayette and another little mall with H&M, Sephora, and a few other stores. Place de la Madeleine is also nearby and don't forget to stop at Fauchon and Hediard for a few gourmet souvenirs. Overall, I was very pleased with my stay and would definitely stay here again. I can't wait to plan my next trip to Paris and stay at Hotel WO again. A few things you must do/see when in Paris: - Notre Dame, climb the bell tower for beautiful views of the city. I actually preferred Notre Dame over the Vatican’s Sistine Chapel – much more intimate and a little less touristy - Seine evening river cruise. We randomly picked Vedettes du Pont Neuf since we happened to cross Pont Neuf and see their sign - we were not disappointed. The cruise has live narration in French and English, though her English was sometimes hard to understand...didn't really care though because I was paying more attention to the beautiful sites. I DO wish that they timed their tours so you pass the Eiffel Tower when it sparkles, but we actually caught views of that from Pont Neuf after the cruise on our way to the metro stop. Look for coupons or buy tickets online for the best discount. - Download Rick Steves' free audioguides for the Paris City Walk and the Louvre (he has other tours for Paris too) - they're actually quite good and you can't beat FREE - Stop by the Trocadero for incredible views of the Eiffel as the sun sets. We got the most amazing pictures of the Eiffel here - the sky looked like a beautiful painting. Just be sure to ignore the irritating gypsies and peddlers - DO book your Eiffel tickets online and don't be bummed if you are only able to secure tickets to the second level. I was somewhat upset that only second level tickets at 10pm were available online, but I booked them anyway. When we finally did our ascent to the second level, there was a ticket booth with only 3 people in line where you could quickly purchase a supplement to the top and hop in line for the ascent to the top! Very pleased that things worked out and we were able to get to the top.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location and comfort”
Reviews.Author: Beth092
Reviews.Content: Room was small but very new and clean. Bed was very comfortable. Location was fantastic right by a train and metro station and near many bars and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Surprise”
Reviews.Author: MikeMaui
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Wilson for one night recently. Location near the train station was of concern but should not have been. Smaller but well appointed, modern rooms with great bathrooms, elevator and wireless internet. Quiet location. Easy stroll to shopping, the Louvre etc. Make sure to ask for Room 602! To our great surprise and delight, it has a balcony with a view to the Eiffel Tower! Can watch the Tower light show at night. Also plenty of room on the balcony for dining al fresco in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, confortable and close to all trains”
Reviews.Author: tripper665
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very small as are the rooms, but, very confortable and clean. The staff was very helpful and spoke English. I would definately recommend this hotet as a place to stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant small hotel close to metro”
Reviews.Author: MLouise10
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the WO - well appointed modern, comfortable small hotel. Friendly and helpful staff, lift, room safe useful, comfortable beds, good breakfast, small quality shower en-suites. Good to have air conditioning unit in room. internet access with one pc in the reception. Quiet business area. Buses and metro around the corner. More places to eat in Opera, 10 mins walk. Rue du bac area interesting on left bank. Small criticisms - classic room - room no drawer space, but managed. A bath would be a plus to soak aching bodies at the end of each day having walked for miles each day sight seeing. The computer keyboard is french we assume - not qwerty. But would stay again, would like to try the Superior room with balcony! Would recommend good quality small hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Modern and Clean but very small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Manna1976
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my husband and 6 year old daughter. We stayed in room 301. Negatives: I was very surprised how small the room was. We were not able to put the suitcase on the floor! We had to open it on bed. Bathroom had shower connected to bathtub, so after the shower the floor was all wet. Positives: Room and Bathroom were modern, good quality and clean. The room was quiet, we did not hear voices from outside. Service was very friendly and helpful, breakfast good for a continental option. Location: 1 minute walk to train, 5 minutes walk to metro, 15 minutes walk to Gallery Lafayette. Few brasseries in the area, small supermarket and pharmacy. Price: We paid 250 euro per night with breakfast. I would look for a better value for money option next time.

Reviews.Title: “Complacent”
Reviews.Author: waterloomole
Reviews.Content: Staff were surly. But it was probably unintentional that they gave us a room that was already occupied - that moment when you realise what has happened before you rush to shut the door and hope the occupant didn't notice. The internet didn't work. The sink didn't drain.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: NYUSA_travelers
Reviews.Content: We chose based on the reviews here, and had a very nice stay. The staff was pleasant and helpful, the hotel location is good (near various metro options) and the room as very nice. Some might say small but it is typical by European standards. The area is pretty quiet, and the hotel has great windows that close tightly and really block out the noise. Some nice dining options nearby, bakeries, a supermarket, etc. A little off the beaten path for the usual tourist sights but we like that, and they are an easy Metro ride away. They had a problem with the elevator during our stay, and had repairmen there over the weekend to fix it, I give them kudos for that. The wifi internet was available at all times although sometimes it did slow down quite a bit, but overall very usable through the stay,

Reviews.Title: “A Little Gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrsT098
Reviews.Content: My husband suprised me with a trip to Paris for my birthday and he had found Hotel WO online. He looked at the trip advisor comments and decided to go with this hotel. I'm so glad he did as our stay was wonderful. Upon arrival we were offered an upgrade to their superior room which had a terrace and view of the Eiffel Tower which was fantastic. The staff were friendly, spoke very good English and were happy to help. The rooms are on the small side but beautifully furnished and it is in a great location. It had a feel of a family run hotel (not sure that it is) so very intimate and the staff knew who you were and what room you were in etc. I would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good spot!”
Reviews.Author: meetjoeblack
Reviews.Content: Wo Wilson Opera, is a good spot in the city center, 15 min.walk to Champs Elysees. The rooms are very small as you expect from a hotel in Paris. Its no problem if you are alone in the room or stay just for several nights. But it can be a problem for longer stays as a couple. The corner rooms are better in size and have really beautiful balconies with a view of Eifell tower.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, convenient location for a good price”
Reviews.Author: rbriley
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at Hotel WO and loved it. Front desk staff was super helpful for helping us with our day to day items. All very friendly and English speaking as well. Room was small but very nice. The entire place has been recently upgraded, and they did a great job. Very clean and modern feeling on the inside. Our room was on the 5th floor and had a great view of Eiffiel tower from our balcony. The location was very convenient as well. Its not super close to any major attraction but the key is its right near the St. Lazaar train station which is one of the best ones as it can get you very easily to anywhere in Paris in just a few minutes. It even connects to many of the RER lines which gets you to the Airport and/or out to Versallies very easily. Right near the hotel are many restuarants, a Starbucks, several Markets and Pharmacies. If we go back to Paris, we'll definitely consider this place again.

Reviews.Title: “No woe at the WO!”
Reviews.Author: Jezzacat
Reviews.Content: This is my first ever Trip Advisor review - the Hotel WO was so good that it seemed only fair to add to the list of glowing reviews! Situated immediately opposite the Gare St Lazare, the hotel has been refurbished to a high standard. Our room over looked the front of the hotel, but amazingly there was no station noise at all. The bijou rooms, whilst of typical french proportions, were absolutely lovely with bathrooms completed to a high specification finish. The air conditioning was extremely efficient without being noisy, which on a warm evening was a great relief! From arrival to departure, the staff were warm, friendly, and highly organised. Our experience of breakfast at the hotel was that the service was excellent and the continental breakfast was of a high standard. On the other mornings we sampled other local cafes - the hotel is very well positioned with a range of local bars and cafe's on hand to provide choice and variety! I'll definitely be returning!!

Reviews.Title: “A real find”
Reviews.Author: MuffinDordogne
Reviews.Content: The 'goods' - while rooms typically Parisien small, they were well equipped, super bed, good and clean bathroom, and superbly soundproofed. No noise from other rooms, from outside or the adjacant lift, so good sleeps had by all. Breakfast fair value for Paris, though a good cafe and viennoiserie opposite the front door too! Reception staff universally polite and helpful. The 'less goods' - not the poshest part of the 8th arrondissement, but no trouble on the streets either when returning late. Gare St Lazare pretty grubby but Paris metro works well, and it (ST Lazare) is a good hub for different lines. Parking was a little way away (with heavy cases) and no discount available for hotel residents.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Place for Good Price!”
Reviews.Author: jomo31313
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Europe, and really look forward to the full Paris experience!We had arrived to Paris after going directly to Disneyland Paris for a couple days. We had stayed one night at the Santa Fe, which is a Disney owned and operated hotel. We were not pleased with the room there, so had less than grand expectations for our Hotel in paris. We arrived at the metro stop (Saint Lazare) and found the hotel was a very short walking distance from the metro. The lobby is small, but very well decorated and the staff were very friendly our entire stay. I booked a Deluxe room, only doing so for the larger bed. We stayed on the top floor in 602, and was blown away by the terrace with the amazing view of the Eiffel Tower! The room was smaller than the rooms we typically have in the US, but it was extremely clean, large bathroom, and nicely decorated and kept up! For the price, I would recommend this hotel to anyone! They ask that you leave your key at the front desk every time you leave, which is great! One last thing to lose!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, good position”
Reviews.Author: marc57
Reviews.Content: A friendly greeting, comfortable but small room, and a good position very close to St Lazare station, and metro. Free wifi

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, but seek indirect booking if possible”
Reviews.Author: LargeJohnWasAware
Reviews.Content: The hotel is excellent. If arriving by bus at night from Beauvais, don't mess about, just get a cab, around 12 euros right to the door. Very friendly, polite and welcoming staff. We had room 602, which is one of two on the 6th floor. The room has a terrace which has spectacular views right onto the Eiffel Tower and the dome of St Augustin's. Sitting with a glass of wine late at night is fantastic. Once you get your bearings, and if you like to walk, you will find all of the sites within a targetted half hour walk. We bought the 2-day ticket for the hop-on-off red bus which we enjoyed much more than the metro. Our room was very, very clean, big bathroom and huge queen size bed. I think overall we struck it very lucky with the room as I had not made any special requests. I would recommend booking through Expedia or similar as our 4 night stay cost £510 for the room (flights booked independently). The tariff on the room door stated that Room 602 was 295 euros per night, so we saved around £600 for the same trip. Having said that, the hotel is in the business district and cost would be no odds if you were on company dollar. Our experience, and luck, resulted in excellent value for money and a great base. Oh and we got engaged into the bargain! Bon chance with your trip!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel with a location that can't be beat!”
Reviews.Author: keppNjenn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel WO during our vacation to Paris. We had split our stay, so we could take a side trip to the countryside, so we were able to stay in two different rooms. Our first room was their superior room, which was very comfortable and clean. Although small by American standards, it was a nice size for Europe, and there was a good use of space. The decor was very tasteful and modern. Our second room was smaller, with just a shower stall in the bathroom, but it was perfectly fine. The best thing by far is the location of this hotel. Just steps to the Gare St. Lazare, you can easily get anywhere around Paris within minutes! And in our case, we even took the train from the station to Normandy. Perfect if you have to lug around suitcases!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel near the city center with great customer service”
Reviews.Author: josh_taylor_henderso
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a wonderful first-trip to Paris. We stayed in the Hotel Wilson-Opera which is located next to the Gare St. Lazare. The hotel is close enough to the city center to allow a moderately fit person to walk to the main attractions (Louvre, Eiffel Tower, Arc de Triomphe, etc ...). We stayed in room 602 which provided a truly magical view of the city from the terrace (including the St. Augustine church and the Eiffel Tower). The room was very well appointed and the staff was very helpful and kind. If I were to offer any criticism at all it would be of the offered breakfasts; they're a little pricey. But since there was a boulangerie across the street ... well, there you go. There is quite a bit of street noise but I think that's to be expected when you're in the middle of a great city.

Reviews.Title: “Our first time in Paris”
Reviews.Author: relaxHallandaleBeach
Reviews.Content: The hotel was selected from Expedia and in general I am satisfied with the selection, the only thing that I did not expected was the size of the room and the space available to use the toilet and were are no big at all. The service and the location were very good.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: LSM79
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for it's location, cost and style. The location was excellent, very close to a main St Lazare station for RER trains and Metro. Easy to get to from CDG airport (but ask for Rue de Stockholm when you get to St Lazarre) and a perfect base to get around Paris by foot or by Metro. We booked a Superior room for added space but were given a Standard room due to our late evening arrival and this was the only flaw. The Standard room and bathroom were very small and cramped with our suitcases, particularly for the price! This is being very picky however and needless to say we had a fantastic time in Paris and can't wait to return

Reviews.Title: “tres bien”
Reviews.Author: dspecial
Reviews.Content: Book your visit to the Eiffel Tower on line the day before you go or you will be waiting hours to go up The hotel is central to St lazaire main railway station and for buses The receptionist was marvellous and very pleasant Visit the latin quarter over by Notredam for food and drink Prices are very steep elsewhere for food and drink Our record was 10.80 euros for a pint of Kronenbourg in a cafe next to Notredam ! Buy your bus tickets on the Eurostar for getting around Paris We had a wonderful weekend and would recommend Paris despite the cost of living

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Gmuzza
Reviews.Content: Very nice little hotel. Great location. Small rooms but perfectly adequate if you don't have a lot of luggage. We were in Room 206 which was stylish and very clean. I paid 140 euros per night for a 2 night stay over the weekend. Good value for me in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: AliboScotland
Reviews.Content: Hidden away on a side street, a stone's throw from the tube station. The rooms were beautifully decorated, if a little 'compact and bijou', though this is Paris after all, and rooms are typically smaller than one might expect. Room was very tastefully decorated and spotlessly clean. Staff were very friendly and helpful at all times. A brilliant locatiion, ideal for shopping at nearby Printemps or Gallerie Lafayette. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Small boutique hotel in a quiet, yet central location”
Reviews.Author: jennifer_thomson
Reviews.Content: This hotel was small in size, but big in cleanliness and service. It is located on a small side street, so it is quiet and safe. However, within a few minutes walk you have convenient stores, restaurants and a central station - Gare St Lazare - which supports both overground and metro train services. I would definitely recommend this hotel for business or leisure, as either type of traveller would receive a great level of service.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect base to discover Paris from”
Reviews.Author: CI_travellerUk
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in a good location around the corner from train/metro station. Very friendly and helpfull staff and because it isn't a huge hotel personal approach too. The rooms are well equiped and although small (which seems to be normal for Paris) things like a big wardrobe (to store suitcase etc) make it more than comfortable. We walked everywhere, but with the train/metro station around the corner and hire bikes right outside the hotel you can choose whatever suits you. Wireless available in the rooms, but for people who don't have their own laptop a computer is available for free. We very much enjoyed our stay at this hotel and will definately stay here again if we return to paris.

Reviews.Title: “Parisien charm with mod-cons. Great value”
Reviews.Author: PaulaNorwich_UK
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at this hotel. Great location. Walking distance of Montmatre, Opera House and the Champs Elysee to name a few tourist locations. The staff were incredibly friendly. I emailed a couple of times to ask questions before the trip and got a prompt reply. Free wi-fi is always handy and if you don't have a laptop, they have a computer in the lobby you can use for free. Rooms were clean and well equipped. They're not the biggest rooms but not as cramped as some I've stayed in. The only complaint I had was that the room was next to the lift and we could hear it going up and down.

Reviews.Title: “Good ... clean, up-to-date furnishings, nice bathroom, good location in 8eme, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: amfzurich
Reviews.Content: I've visited Paris about 10 times including many multi-day trips. First time staying in the 8th. Enjoyed it. Good access to public transport and decent cafes in the immediate vicinity. Friendly, helpful staff. Smallish room, but that's to be expected for Paris in this price range. But all the furnishings -- lights, bed, furniture -- were quite up-to-date and of good quality. Quiet location. A comfortable place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, helpful staff, perfect choice.”
Reviews.Author: sheepgirl54
Reviews.Content: Friends and I were going for a short break to Paris. We wanted to do all the usual touristy things. This hotel was perfectly located. There are loads of shops, cafes and restaurants around and a major metro station that took us pretty much everywhere we needed to go. The hotel was clean, the staff were very helpful and friendly. The standard rooms are cosy but very well done up and equipped. I have no problem recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem in the Parisian crown”
Reviews.Author: tellum1808
Reviews.Content: This was my first experience of Paris, and indeed France, and I have to say I loved every minute of it. The hotel definitely played it's part - The room was smart and clean, and had a touch of French class about it. I thought the style in which they were decorated was similar to that of 'Malmaison' hotels I've stayed in, albeit slightly smaller. I have to give a special mention to the reception staff, who were more than helpful throughout with any query I had. A special mention to Fathi, the concierge we met on our first night and subsequent nights after that; he went above and beyond the call of duty on several occasions to ensure we had the best possible time, whether that be recommending a restaurant - giving us information to help us get around cheaply or showing me where I could get a birthday card at the last minute to avoid an argument with the missus!! The rooms were cleaned every day with fresh towels delivered and the free Tea and Coffee supplies replenised! Free wifi, a Metro station on the doorstep and a Supermarket round the corner put the icing on the cake to make this one of my most memorable holidays ever!! Definitely going back!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: dhong2171
Reviews.Content: We walk everywhere from here. Eiffel Tower, Latin Quarter, Louvre, Sacre Coure, Champs d'ellysee, and Seine river cruise. Highly recommend Latin Quarter for lunch or dinner, where you can get many 3 course meals for either 10 or 15 euro each, and a bottle of wine is 10-20 euro. Go past the restaurants on the corner of St Michel at the Latin Quarter as these are a rip off. We got Bus #21 back from Latin Quarter. Drinks on Champs DE are very expensive. Rooms are great! We upgrade to superior and stayed in room 502. Lots of bakeries, stores to buy wine, etc just around the corner. Food and wine everywhere in Paris! Wifi works great. Dont hear any noise from the street or neighbouring rooms. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrsSBradbrook
Reviews.Content: Very quaint hotel, lovely room, very friendly service on reception, could not fault the hotel at all during our stay, would recommend to anyone, and would stay their again on our next trip to Paris. Great location also, which made walking everywhere very quick and easy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and cute hotel in the city centre”
Reviews.Author: aldapooh
Reviews.Content: The only bad thing in this hotel is a slow elevator. All the other things are just nice. rooms might be tiny sometimes. Breakfast is typical French! :) Staff is extremely friendly. Surroundings are just great - 10 minutes to Opera by feet - who wants more? Restaurants all around, shops, - so highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, although hotel website pictures make it more than it is...”
Reviews.Author: caranddriver
Reviews.Content: Positives: Great team at the front desk. Yadira is a gem. Geniunely pleasant, and helpful. Every restaurant that was recommended was perfect and within walking distance. Le Carre for quick bite, cafe food, or drinks. Chez Mollard for excellent brasserie atmosphere and seafood. Hotel also close walking distance to Gare St. Lazare train station, as well as the major department stores like Galeries Lafayette & Printemps, but set far enough away from the noise and the traffic. Good buffet breakfast. Croissants, pastries, cereals, packaged cheeses, and cold cuts... Room interior thoughtfully designed to maximize the space. Nice to have heated towel rack in bathroom.. Good shower pressure. Comfortable beds and pillows. FYI, when you ask for a room with two beds, be forewarned the beds are two twin mattressess fitted next to each other without any space in between! A little too close for comfort if you are traveling with someone other than your spouse. Negatives: Bad for claustrophic, or overweight people -- rooms very small, cabin-like. Not much space for more than 1 luggage. Closet also only good for one person if traveling with heavy winter coats... While the hotel offers shampoo, cleanser and tiny soap bars, its best to bring your own toiletries ~ no q-tips, cotton pads, body lotions.. No room service available.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ilurveparis
Reviews.Content: i gotta be honest that this hotel is not bad for the cleanliness and distance to printemps or shopping area but the location is nearby st lazare station and it has lots of homeless people and its totally not safe to walk alone or as a couple at night. Most of the rooms are small beyond any other hotel rooms in paris and the worst thing is the receptionist....a bald tall guy with the good english...he is very rude and made our stay very uncomfortable. i am sorry but i will never ever stay at this hotel again. i wonder how it can be on number 32 in trip advisor.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: sue6000
Reviews.Content: My husband and I like to stay close to a metro so we can travel around the city. This hotel was only a couple of blocks from a major train station. It was perfect for us. Paris has a wonderfu metro/train system. The hotel was clean; our room was small but we didn't need much since we were gone all day and into the evening. I liked the bright bathroom. So many hotel bathrooms are dimly lit; not this one. I even soaked in the bathtub after walking around Paris all day. Free Wi-Fi is a plus for us. Someone at reception always spoke English. We would recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SazE19
Reviews.Content: Brilliantly located in the 8th arrondissement - short walk to local cafes, restaurants, supermarkets, train & metro - 5 mins, not far to main tourist attractions - walkable if you fancy a decent (20-30min walk) or very easily accessible by metro. Fabulous hotel - small rooms but this is expected in Paris, immensely clean, ours on 4th floor had small but decent-enough sized bathroom with powerful (though not electric/power) shower & bath. Small breakfast room but rarely busy so great all you can eat continental breakfast for €13. Quiet location - no traffic noise. Staff spoke English very well and were extremely friendly, welcoming & helpful; we had no problems while there in order that staff had to get involved but I'm sure they would have dealt with any issues had they arose with professionalism. Most impressed with the WIFI, which for us was fantastic - very quick & made planning trips, speaking to family on skype and generally using the internet very easy. A big thumbs up for the Hotel WO; we'd definately stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, clean and cosy”
Reviews.Author: Dmaic
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated near the opera, very near to many shops and galleries Lafayette and only 2 min from the metro station. The room is not very small as it is common in Paris, the bed is very comfortable and the soundproofing is amazing. The staff is very friendly, and the reception is open 24/7. The elevator is a bit slow but this is a minor issue.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a wonderful location and excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: Cassie088
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in the Wilson Opera for 7 nights in December of this year. Initially, we were very impressed with the excellent service of the hotel staff. We arrived at night and were met with a receptionist who spoke perfect English, she was very efficient and we were in our rooms within 5 minutes! One of the best things about the hotel is the flawless wireless service, we both have iPhones and were able to connect up immediately with a fast connection. This was very important to us as we were able to keep in touch with our families and work back home. We were upgraded to a larger room which was a wonderful surprise so we had plenty of room and a very, very comfortable bed! The location of the hotel is fantastic, just around the corner from the bustling shopping area with the big department stores. Although we didn't use the train the station was right at the hotel. There was also a supermarket 1 minute away which was very convenient. The hotel however, is placed on a quiet street and reception has a good system of keeping your keys so you don't need to worry about losing it! Every day our room was beautifully cleaned which was great for us who are pretty messy! We were further impressed with the hotel when we returned home. We left behind a piece of jewellery we purchased in Europe and were very upset when we couldn't find it, but we emailed the hotel and they had already started organising to send it back home, we were incredibly grateful for the hotel's care in cleaning the room after we left and finding it, also at the honesty of the cleaning staff! Overall, we give the hotel a huge thumbs up! Definitely stay there :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very modern style, little overpriced in my view.”
Reviews.Author: TheFirrs
Reviews.Content: Good: Location, Business travellers would prob be ideal for them, Very clean, Modern Style if you like that sort of thing, Great travel links Bad: Expensive for what it is, Very small rooms (although you are in Paris...), Basic Breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy little hotel with absolutely great service and location! Will definitely return!!”
Reviews.Author: Poshlim
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Wilson Opera Hotel for 3 very comfortable and cozy nights. We simply love every bit of the hotel. Though the rooms are small, they are cozy and warm. Staffs are really awesome! They were very prompt in their email replies when we did the booking prior to our arrival though there were many questions. The staffs are very friendly and helpful! Location is fantastic! Supermarket, restaurants, brasserie are just next to the hotel. We found a hidden gem chinese restaurant by the name Lantern R....really good chinese food they served! Most of all, Galaries Lafayate and Printemps are just really minutes walk from the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Wilson Opera is a great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: austintoanywhere
Reviews.Content: Hotel Wilson Opera is a great find. It's right by the train/metro station, has a grocery store right around the corner, and is itself clean, modern, and quiet. The room was small, but that was to be expected. They did a good job making the space user-friendly. The staff was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “The best European Boutique Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Fussytraveller2828
Reviews.Content: A service far better than what the city can offer! The word 'No' was never in their vocabulary. The warmth welcome and service given by the staff helps in the chilly Autumn month. We were given an upgrade to a superior room which was appreciated. Room size was much bigger than average Parisien hotel. All the room amenities that you will need are there. Location is convenient and near the Metro with just a few minutes walk away. Near Galleries Lafayette and less than half an hour walk to major attractions like the Louvre, Champs Elysees. Safe environment as compared to Gare Du Nord area. Will definitely recommend this hotel to first time traveller to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, friendly, trendy and well located hotel... superb!”
Reviews.Author: Holidayseeker2
Reviews.Content: On arrival we were given a superb welcome from the happy and friendly receptionist. We were delighted to find out we'd been upgraded to the only room on the top floor which had a balcony and view of the Eiffel Tower. It was amazing. The room was a good size (for Paris) and the bathroom was very big. The decor is very trendy and overall we felt we'd found a real gem of a hotel. Location is excellent, just near St Lazare station so easy to get about. We chose to walk everywhere and it was very easy. The lady on reception was excellent, providing advise and tips for bars and restaurants all of which were outstanding. Never before have we had a view of the Eiffel tower from our room, and given everything else was so good, we believe this is one of the best hotels in this price bracket in Paris. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel.”
Reviews.Author: doctobe
Reviews.Content: There are lot's of points about this hotel so i'll divide them into good and bad. Good points: - Excellent access from the metro and the connection to all the major landmarks is fantastic. - Lot's of restaurants, cafes and bars right on door step. - Very well appointed hotel, with rooms and bathrooms of a good quality. - Very friendly staff and 24hr reception - free Wi-fi which we used with no problem and founf to be of a good speed. Bad points: - rooms are small, we were there for one week and didn't really have enough room to unpack. Need more shelves! - very warm rooms, Ok in winter but prob uncomfortable in summer. Overall a very good a hotel in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: lesm68
Reviews.Content: Lovely little hotel in a great location, 5 minutes from metro station, bars and supermarket. Nice cosy rooms with free wifi, my only gripe was that we were put in a disabled room which had a wet room which I personally don't like and it smelt of dirty drains.

Reviews.Title: “A superb hotel, fantastic staff and rates”
Reviews.Author: dominicbrennan
Reviews.Content: I wanted to surprise my girlfriend by taking her to Paris for a few days. I shuffled through tons of reviews for Hotel WO and they were all excellent, was it all too good to be true? Well for what you pay you get a fantastic room, very modern and contemporary whilst still being elegant. A view of the Paris skyline if you are high enough comes too. The staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful at all times and went out of their way to suggest places to see routes to take. The Hotel is situated in a lovely part of Paris, a very short metro ride away from all of the big tourist hotspots. I can only implore fellow romantics to book this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location, brilliant staff. Highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: Sharpshooter357
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well situated both from its destination point - close to Gare St Lazare (RER & Metro) and Roissybus (from Charles De Gaul Airport) - plus its proximity to attractions (Opera Garnier, Louvre, Arc de Triomphe, Eiffel Tower, etc.) and shopping (Printemps, Gallerie Lafayette, and cafes, restaurants, pharmacies, 'Starbucks' etc.). The hotel was very modern, clean and well decorated. The breakfast room was in the basement but is similarly very clean and attractive - serving cereals,fresh fruit, orange juice, coffee, rolls, croissants, cheeses, meats, yogurt,preserves, danish pastries - the room is accessed by both stairs and lift. All the staff - dining/reception/chamber maids/maintenance - are all very helpful and of a pleasant disposition. The bedroom was of a reasonable size, clean, well decorated, modern flat screen TV, bright clean bathroom, tea/coffee making facilities, mini-bar, modern duvet bedding - and nice and quiet. We stayed for six nights and would happily stay there again if/when we go back to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: johnfcoppin
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is a gem. Conveniently located close to Gare Saint Lazaire with connecting routes via metro and RER. Hotel is modern, opened October 2009 with 30 bedrooms. Bedrooms are small, which is typical of Paris, but well furnished with comfortable bed. We found the staff to be polite and very helpfull. The breakfast room is small but more than adequate with a good range of typical continental breakfast items AND fresh orange juice. Local Bar/Restaurants are close by, within 5 minute walk. Try "Cour de Roma", opposite station, good food at a reasonable price. We will definately be staying here whenever we are in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PnGDublin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the WO hotel for 4 nights and we loved it! The Hotel was easy to find from the Grand Lazaare train station (we flew in to charles de gaulle). Hotel is within walking distance of the Opera/Gallery lafayette area, and with the train station so close, there's plenty of metro's and buses that will bring you anywhere in Paris. Upon arrival we were greeted by friendly staff. Nicolas gave us advice on bus, metro and local places to eat. We were also upgraded to a superior room, as they had no rooms with a view available. Our room was on the 4th floor, facing offices and a quiet street. It was quite small, but it's Paris. We did have plenty of storage space, flat screen tv (only 1 english station, but you don't go to Paris to watch tv), and a comfortable king size bed. The room was clean, and very nicely decorated. The bathroom was a good size and shower was excellent! Unfortunately, the breakfast was not included and at 13 euro per person we thought it was a bit too expensive. However, there's plenty of places around. We just went to the McDonald's around the corner, which cost us under 10 euro for the 2 of us. All in all, it was a really good stay, and it definitely enhanced our experience in Paris. Would recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: caithlene
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay! Nice decor, excellent location!

Reviews.Title: “Small Boutique Hotel, newly renovated, great staff.”
Reviews.Author: couple040
Reviews.Content: We were happy with our choice of the WO hotel guided by Trip Advisor. The rooms were small but well appointed & very clean. It was great to have a balcony to view the Eiffel Tower.The staff spoke English & were amazingly helpful. The breakfast was good. We took the bus to sightsee which was very close as were the train & subway stations Saint Lazarre.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: boulderave
Reviews.Content: Good hotel. 10-15 minute walk to Opera Garnier, Printemps, Galeries Lafayette. The Louvre, Madeleine just a little longer.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: JG199
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently with my husband and 7 month old baby. We had driven in from Bayeaux and had arrived 2 hours earlier than check in. Not only were we able to check into our room at that time, but we were told we had been upgraded! We were on the 6th floor in room 602 with a balcony and view of the Eiffel Tower. Yadira was extremely helpful in every way, as were all the staff. The location is great being quite central to everything you would want to see in Paris, especially if shopping is your thing. Galleries Lafayette and Printemps are about a 10 min walk. I would definitely recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Chic and modern find in Opera Quarter”
Reviews.Author: americaninparis050
Reviews.Content: The decor is super chic and modern. Friendly staff that speaks English. Great location next to train station making it easy to go to places like Versailles. Good cafes and boulangeries nearby as well. The only complaint is the size of the rooms, but this is normal for Paris. Great rate booked on Expedia!

Reviews.Title: “Tiny -- but nice”
Reviews.Author: lwmueller
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very, very small -- even by European standards -- but overall the place is really nice. I'm not sure it's worth the money (I paid about $250/night) but then again, Paris is an extremely expensive city. The location is pretty great. The Printemps and Galleries LaFayette are close for shopping and the Place de la Concorde is only about 20 minutes away (and the walk itself is nice). Average accessibility to public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice room.”
Reviews.Author: snoozedoctor
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights. The rooms are small, but well appointed and comfortable. The bed was very comfortable. The desk staff were very congenial and helpful. The hotel is well situated close enough to the things we wanted to see that we walked everywhere. However, there is a metro station very close by, if you want to go that route. There are multiple good eateries close by. I thought the room was reasonably priced, all things considered.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, courteous and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Neil082
Reviews.Content: Great location--5 minutes to metro station, 10-15 minutes to Opera House. Newly renovated rooms, however, basic room was far too small for 2 people. we had to upgrade to a larger room at an additional 25 Euros per night. All staff were exceptionally helpful with directions, restaurant recommendations, reservations etc. Overall good value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Andrew1979
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel recently for 3 nights and would highly recommend it. The location of the hotel is excellent and many attractions are walkable. For attractions further away the hotel is close to Saint Lazare Metro / Railway station. The staff was excellent , rooms are clean, good bed, modern throughout and is reasonably priced for a hotel in Paris. Rooms are a bit small but I beleive that is typical of hotel rooms in Paris. Overally I would highly recomment this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: jallah12
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful. I stayed with my husband for the first part of our honeymoon. We booked through Expedia. We arrived and the hotle had upgraded our room to one with a balcony and view of the Eiffel Tower on account that we were on our honeymoon. The staff was especially helpful with makng suggestions to restaurants and providing directions. All this and they would not except the tips when we tried to give it to them. The hotel itself is wonderful although the rooms are a little small....but that's the norm for Paris. It's centrally located so everything is a short train ride away. We will definately stay here again when we return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “no objection”
Reviews.Author: ivanini
Reviews.Content: i was pleasantly surprised by the wilson opera hotel. it is located on a quiet street, a few minutes from saint lazare metro station. the room was relatively small but exceptionally clean (for Paris) and comfortable. the hotel staff are extremely polite, professional and very helpful (they speak english, italian, spanish). without any hesitation, I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and efficient in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Patch42
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Wilson for two nights and found that it was in a great location as the St. Lazare metro, suburban and mainline trains were only 200 metres away. Ideal for getting around Paris and accessing outlying attractions like Versailles and Monet's garden in Giverny. The staff at the hotel were professional, helpful and courteous and the rooms were very clean, even if they were a little on the small side, but that doesn't really matter if you are out and about all day. Will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “LOVELY CLEAN HOTEL IN GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Amy-Merx
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Paris for August bank holiday weekend. The hotel was booked as part of a package with Expedia. We were pleasantly surprised by the Wilson Opera. Great location close to Saint Lazare station with good transport links to the main tourist sights. It is located on a quiet street which made a lovely resting place after a hectic day in the city. Our room was beautifully decorated throughout, a good size (for Paris!) and exceptionally clean. We opted for breakfast not included and instead took advantage of some of the local cafes. Staff at the hotel were reasonably friendly when we needed any information or help, but otherwise left us to ourselves. Recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and wallet friendly”
Reviews.Author: traak
Reviews.Content: For 119 EUR in the heart of Paris, this is a great option. The rooms are on the small side but tastefully decorated with Mini Bar and Flat Screen TV. Very clean and cozy. Breakfast included! Will come again....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, perfect choice”
Reviews.Author: gkel
Reviews.Content: I really cannot find something bad for this hotel, i was amazed by their professionalism, the location was great, the stuff was extra-helpful, the room (even though small) was perfect, nicely furnished and clean, breakfast was ok. Conclusively, if i ever go to Paris again, i'll definately choose this hotel and recommend it to everyone i know.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, absolutely fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: anand195
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at this hotel for 3 nights during our Paris / Switzerland visit in July (9-10-11). The hotel is located in an ideal place connected to all means of transport. Overall the rooms were a bit small (Pretty clean) but for the given price I would say it was a good deal. Hotel staff was fabulous and supported us in every way to make life easy.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Wonderful Stay in this Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Seira14
Reviews.Content: Beautiful and affordable 3star hotel in Paris. Hotel staffs are extremely polite and very helpful.. The room was very clean and smelled so fresh as we checked in, and housekeeping provided very good service..The WIFI is very good..The hotel is very easy from Saint Lazare Station..The location is perfect to explore Paris all around. I felt very safe walking in that area as when we were coming back to the hotel quiet late..I would defintely stay there if I am going to Paris, and absolutely recomment WO..

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Beautiful Paris”
Reviews.Author: EFC22
Reviews.Content: Staying at Hotel Wilson Opera was a great decision - the hotel was very very comfortable for our 3 night stay. Everyone in our group of 5 was happy with the accommodation, location and especially the service provided to us by all the staff. Breakfast was always a great start to the day. enjoyed together in the lovely basement dinning area. Walking around the area and to some of the sights of Paris was easy. The rooms are small but beautifully formed, quiet and always clean and comfy - the doona a bit heavy for summer. If you need a hotel in Paris, stay at Hotel Wilson Opera - we could have stayed longer.+

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and location”
Reviews.Author: Moundou
Reviews.Content: This place is ideal for Paris if you are on a budget. Remember, this is not the USA so don't expect huge rooms with A/C etc.. The breakfast buffet is great!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel, Good Location, and Exceptional Staff”
Reviews.Author: CanadianCouple53
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in many places during our travels, I can without question say this was one of the top five hotels I have booked with. The facilities were gorgeous as the hotel has been recently renovated and updated. The amenities in the rooms were fantastic. The location was convenient to get around Paris. Further, the hotel buffet breakfast was great. Nice selection and a very fair price for an all-you-can-eat buffet. While the hotel itself is fantastic, it is the staff that make staying here so worthwhile. Yadira and Fathi (weekday day and night staff members) were simply outstanding. They were helpful, friendly, had good knowledge of the areas and transit systems, and always took the time to show you on maps where to go to make your trip easier. I have never felt so at ease in a city where I didn't speak the native language well and had never been soley due to the helpful staff at Hotel Wilson Opera. Merci Yadira et Fathi. Vous nous avez donné un service exceptionnel! I would recommend this hotel to ANYONE without hesitation. If you want a very comfortable stay in a welcoming environment in Paris, book with Wilson Opera.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hidden gem near Gare St. Lazare”
Reviews.Author: jillv1701h
Reviews.Content: Absolutely incredible little hotel with beautiful rooms that are both cozy yet spacious. We actually stayed near the opening of the hotel itself, so everything was in tip top condition. The artistic and trendy design of the rooms and the hallways were quite impressive and the place just seemed to maximize the space avialable as nothing seemed quite claustrophobic (even though the entire property was relatively small). There was a computer in the lobby and the desk agent always seemed polite and friendly. Only problem occured when the elevator went out of order and trapped my parents in the elevator for a few minutes. It wasn't a big deal as since it was new, kinks had to be sorted out. The staff was so apologetic they offered us free breakfast. So, overall a wonderful place I would not hesitate to return to.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem with top service and stylish elegant rooms”
Reviews.Author: Ulrike_Christian
Reviews.Content: After a real warm welcome we have been upgraded for free from Classiq room to Superior room. He also offered us the DeLuxe room with private roof terrace and view over Paris to the Eiffel tower for a little extra. We accepted as the room was very large and the private roof terrace and the view were unbeatable and worth it. The whole venue was very clean and staff was very helpful. The room had Aircon and tea/coffee facilities and a bathroom with all toilletries needed. It is located just a few minutes walk from St. Lazare and St. Augustine Metro. Overall this will be my first choice for a stay in Paris and if possible the "room with a view".

Reviews.Title: “totally awesome”
Reviews.Author: sassyscameron
Reviews.Content: this place is really a great find. i had read a lot of review saying that most hotel staff were rude but this place was outstanding! the staff were really friendly and helpful! the postion was also fantastic- easy to find! the rooms were very modern and very clean. the bathrooms may be considered small and the shower curtains not brillant, but they didnt bother me....i still thought it was great (compared to some hostel we stayed in!) the breakfast are totally worth the extra 10 euro or whatever it is. it was very centrally located. we were bummed we didnt stay longer!

Reviews.Title: “"Fantastic"”
Reviews.Author: Dagger21
Reviews.Content: Hotel fantastic, fresh breakfast was very good . We enjoyed our stay. The hotel was clean and tidy all the time, staff were friendly and efficient all the time and spoke very good English (nice Curly day receptionist and night receptionist Pati ) , which made it relaxing for us.The fact that it was close to Saint lazare station made it so easy for us to go everywhere rapidly. One thing! The room was kind of small but that is normal for Paris standarts i guess.We will be going again, highly recommend .

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in the most convienient location of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Riddlers69
Reviews.Content: Spotless rooms and lobby. Literally brand new renovations. Front Desk provided amazing service with directions and provided european outlet adapters and free use of PC, internet and color printer. Our room had a balcony on the top floor with a view of the Eiffel Tower and the AC in the room was amazing considering how few restaurants had AC. Would recommend for small couples as the rooms are slightly small but that is the case with all of Paris, i'm sure.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Wilson Opera Gets 2 Thumbs Up!”
Reviews.Author: jkaldis
Reviews.Content: The rooms and bathrooms were small but nicely appointed and spotlessly clean. The location was great--close to train and metro stations as well as within walking distance to many major sites. We had a great night's sleep as the rooms were quite. The staff was excellent, especially Fathi, who helped with directions and the day staff who helped with airport transfers. We would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service”
Reviews.Author: MommyYo
Reviews.Content: This was my third trip to Paris and my previous trip was just a year ago. I would have to say that the service was top notch. The front desk personnel was always with a ready and friendly smile. Yadira was such a great help and recommended restaurants near the hotel for dinner (the hotel has a whole folder of this) and helped me book a tour. I booked the Superior Room which was spacious (and in Paris, this is not usually the case), well appointed, comfortable and clean. I ended up extending another 2 nights stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible location and staff”
Reviews.Author: Lovestravel60
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our first 7 day stay in Paris. We were delightfully pleased and surprised by the Hotel Wilson Opera. It is much more conveniently located than we had originally thought. The hotel is within walking distance of the St. Lazare train station and metro line and is also convenient to the Villiers metro line as well. We found the staff incredibly friendly, helpful, and willingly speak very fluent English. They also provided a small map of Paris with a metro map included that helped us immensely. The hotel is also located close to many great neighborhood restaurants. The rooms were small by U.S. standards, but we had more than enough room. Besides, your in Paris to see the sights, right? The room was clean, the bed was great, nice TV, and we were never bothered by the cleaning staff wanting to clean our room before we left. It didn't matter if we left early or slept in, they always waited for us to be out of the room. We can definitely recommend this hotel, and will stay gladly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel”
Reviews.Author: HappyBunny99
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights and were very impressed. Hotel was clean, beautifully decorated and being given a disabled room due to limited space our room was an impressive size too. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful, spoke fluent english. We didnt try the breakfast, purely because we tended to eat breakfast on the go but did go down to the restaurant area to use the toilet and it was also very tasteful and pleasant. The hotel is in a great location, pretty close to everything and with good metro links, the gare st lazare being literally just around the corner. Also from here easy links to disneyland. On price, I think we got a late deal so it was cheaper but I think compared to the prices of other hotels in paris and the location/standard it is good value. Absolutely no complaints and would definately recommend.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL CHOICE IN PARIS”
Reviews.Author: I-HSUAN
Reviews.Content: I have been to Paris severa times and tried staying at different hotels. My friend and I chose WO this time based on the tripadvisor reviews for our 9-night stay in Paris and the services and the quality of the hotel team performance do exceed our expecations! Especially the staffs, they are fluent in English, very helpful and considerate! As to the room, though the space it a bit small (similar to what is provide in other 3-4 star hotels), the room is clean and cozy. Moreover, the hotel's location is just perfect with easy access to many metro and bus lines. I will definitely come back to WO for my next trip to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: CarolinaTravelerGal
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. It was spotless and beautifully decorated. It had been newly remodeled so everthing was new and in great working order. The staff was great and very friendly. The rooms are small, but you expect that in Europe. We did not try the breakfast, so we can't comment. Easy access to the metro and trains The room was extremley quite. We will stay in this hotel again, when in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: irreplaceable4
Reviews.Content: Our daughter paid for this Hotel for a special celebration for us. We stayed in Room 601 which was a superior room as opposed to the standard room. The room is very modern, clean but small. We are from South Africa but live in the UK now and are used to much bigger rooms in SA but, considering that the hotel is around the corner from the Saint Lazare station which is a RER and Metro station and just up the road from a bus stop for the Paris L'Open bus tour it is very very central. We found the staff to be very friendly - even though we could not speak French - the only exception was the grumpy male staff member who was on duty on Monday 14th June 2010. The lady who was on duty on Tuesday and Wednesday was FABULOUS - no question was to stupid and her English was very good. We had asked for instructions from Gare du Nord (where Eurostar comes into) and these were given promptly and very informatively. We required a formal letter confirming booking for our Schengen visa and once again - this was done promptly. We enjoyed our stay! When we saw our daughter on our return today (16th June 2010) she said we looked so well. Thank you to the staff at Hotel Wilson-Opera!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel, Fab Staff”
Reviews.Author: than76
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel WO for three nights recently while exploring Paris. It was a great starting point each day as we headed out to the requisite sites around the city. The staff are genuinely friendly, extremely helpful, and their command of English is impeccable, which was great for two people whose French is less than adequate. Yadira, one of the staff members, made sure we knew our way to Orly International Airport and found us the easiest route--via the Air France shuttle outside of the Invalides metro stop (about 11.50 Euro per person). She was so helpful and even suggested one of our favorite restaurants during our stay--Le Carre, just a block from the Hotel. The rooms are clean, modern, comfy, although a bit crammed. Their wasn't much room to put down our suitcases, but the comfortable layout and clean, well designed bathroom made up for the small room. I guess we didn't expect a huge room in a city like Paris. The hotel is just a three minute walk to St. Lazare Metro (even closer for the above-ground train), and there is a Velib kiosk (www.velib.paris.fr/) which we used more than once to bike around Paris.

Reviews.Title: “excellent welcome and clean well presented rooms”
Reviews.Author: redtrcaker333
Reviews.Content: Paris is an expensive city and so the price of a stay in Paris isn't going to be cheap, and if it is, then maybe you get what you pay for. Hotel Wilson opera isn't cheap but you get what you pay for and more. The welcome and service is excellent. It was a very simple set up with someone on the desk to answer any questions you might have and to be a friendly face to the hotel. So there is a sense of privacy and yet not that anonymous hotel bleakness that some places have. The rooms are very clean, and I mean very! The one we stayed in is small, and ample too (they do have larger rooms for more euros. I decided that i would rather send the money on french pastries and bordeaux.) The room had safe deposit box, mini bar fridge that you can keep things cool, and a balcony overlooking the eiffel tower in the distance. We didn't breakfast here.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in my Europe travel”
Reviews.Author: franzbs
Reviews.Content: Great rooms, excellent staff, delicious breakfast. Very, very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: anne2523
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights over a weekend. Too may times hotels display pictures of rooms that do not at all represent what you end up with. This was completely untrue at Hotel Wo. The room looked almost exactly like the picture posted on their website. We had plenty of space for our luggage, which we have not enjoyed in our previous 2 trips to Paris. By American standards, it is not a large room or bathroom, but in Paris, it is spacious and perfect. It was apparent that the hotel had been recently renovated as it is very modern and spotlessly clean. The location is the only possible negative as it is right near the St. Lazare train station area, which was quite dirty (maybe because it was the weekend?) and not extremely close to any major tourist sights. The location could be a positive though as metro lines and trains are close. Also, across the street from the station, we enjoyed a cheap dinner one night and croissants, coffee, pastries, juice, etc. for breakfast for 8 euro total (breakfast in the hotel was 10 euro/person I think). We could walk to Madeleine Place in 10 minutes with plenty of bars and restaurants along the way. We will be staying here again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: corgan12
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with beautiful decorated rooms, yet tiny but average size for Paris. Staff extremely friendly and helpful. Perfect location on quiet street yet near to the Opera and a lot of sightseeings. Free deposit of luggage after checking out for the intire day. Would definitely go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Tight fit, but great hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Jescas
Reviews.Content: Pros: Room was very nice and clean Location very close to St. Lazare station makes getting around Paris quite easy via Subway Hotel staff friendly and helpful Cons: Bed very hard Room on the small side Overall, had a great experience and would stay at hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem!”
Reviews.Author: rcorso
Reviews.Content: Our first ever trip to Europe and our first hotel was WO. Although the rooms are small they are more than pleasant to stay in. After all you are in Europe and you spend most of the day out. We loved this hotel and especially the staff. They were extremely helpful and a real pleasure to talk to. There is free internet in the lobby, tea and coffee in your room (something we didn't see much of in our travels), modern decore and a great shower (love a great shower head) We were afraid to take the metro but were advised by the staff and so glad we did. It was a few metres away and easy to use. My advise, definetly stay at this hotel....we searched and searched and so glad I chose this one. Price was perfect considering what you can pay for the same price in Pars.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Gvendi
Reviews.Content: The room is not very big (normal by Paris standards), but very clean and comfortable. The staff is excellent! This is the best service I've ever met!! I would surely choose this hotel for my future staying in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: VladutAlba
Reviews.Content: Great hotel as location and also for the provided services. Nice staff, always available and at our disposal with info and anything we may need. Located 200m from Saint Lazare it is great because it gives you the possibility to see all the attractions very easy. Just try not to walk by night in the station and choose the taxis for evening and nights' walking. Book the hotel without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutly fabulous except rooms a little small”
Reviews.Author: JoeTMoorpark
Reviews.Content: The staff, price/value, and location were top notch. I was in a smaller room and would have preferred a larger room.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Hotel Wilson Opera”
Reviews.Author: ChristyBarcelona
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for three nights after reading many Tripadvisor reviews beforehand. Yes, this was a really nice hotel. It was small but very modernly decorated. My great surprise was to discover that we had one of the only rooms with a balcony (no furniture or anything) where you could step outside and actually see the Eiffel Tower. I think only the fifth floor had balconies. It was a very quiet hotel, very friendly staff, nice location, and all and all comfortable. I only have two small complaints. I did not like that the hair dryer was the type that resemble vacuums and have very little power, and I found the pillows really hard. The bed overall was nice, and the room had all the niceties you would expect from a boutique hotel: coffee/tea with pretty china, lovely soaps and shower gels, nice towels, and a very large flat screen TV. I would definitely stay here again (and bring my own hairdryer!) :-)

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant and helpful staff, not like the rest of Paris”
Reviews.Author: DodoPrague
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel cca 4 months before my trip. Paris is expensive city so the hotel price was some where on my higher limit. I came from Bevais Airport and I was completely lost because I didn't know where the airport shuttle bus dropped us. I called the hotel and I've got perfect descprition how to get there. When we arrived to hotel there was a young girl (unfortunaly I don't remember her name), with curly dark hair, who was always very helpful and the real treasure for the hotel. Hotel is very close to Metro Station Gare St.Lazare and you can get everywhere you need to go... Good and quite location. I would definitely choose this hotel again. There is a coffee/tea maker available at the room. We didn't have a breakfast because there is a shop from 8 to 21 near metro (on the way) and you can buy fresh croissants there. I guess everybody needs to see Paris but on the other hand I've been in better places and capitals...

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: cquad40
Reviews.Content: Just spent 4 nights at this lovely hotel. Good location, close to several metro lines, Opera Garnier and Galeria Lafayette. Clean and quiet. Good breakfast but a bit expensive (14 euros).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Even Better Staff”
Reviews.Author: MackOttawa
Reviews.Content: What really makes this hotel are the very helpful and friendly staff. The rooms themselves are clean, nicely decorated, small but well laid out. It is on a relatively quiet street and we were able to sleep with the window open which was unexpected. The nearby Gare St. Lazare offers many choices for getting around including RER, 4 metro lines and also is a major hub for the bus service. Taxis are also not that expensive in Paris and we used them in the evening when high heels were involved. It is also close to very much shopping. As a tip in the area, I would highly recommend the Prunier Café for outstanding seafood.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: catarinagomes
Reviews.Content: We liked the hotel very much, the personnel is very nice and the decoration very well chosen. The room was very cosy but small (as every hotel in paris, I believe). It's a good area for transports but not to good to go out at night as the area of the station isn´t very safe. Despite this we could walk everywhere during the day (it's a 30 minutes walk to get to the Louvre).

Reviews.Title: “For an amazing mini-break in Paris...”
Reviews.Author: riivers
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the start of April for a two night trip. On arrival the staff were very helpful and friendly, and within 15 minutes we were checked in, unpacked and ready to explore Paris. We had one of the top floor luxury rooms, which for ~60-70 euros a night more is well worth it - you get a big room (especially for Paris), a huge bed, balcony and large bathroom. The staff also gave us alot of tips since this was our first time, reccomending restaurants and ways to get around - if going to the eiffel tower from this hotel, don't take the Metro - we were reccomended a bus that goes from a stop 20 secs away from the hotel which goes past alot of the attractions on its way (if you buy single use metro tickets these are also valid for bus travel). I would reccomend the 1 hour boat trip that leaves just next to the Eiffel tower - for 10euros its a must do. Also, a 5 minute walk away from the hotel is a big shopping district ranging from a designer department store (Harrods-esque but for a slightly younger crowd, it had a whole floor just for shoes) to traditional french shops. You are also very close to the theatre district. The hotel does offer breakfast although we never had it. Overall this is a hotel in a great location and at a great price, you can't really go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: agregoire
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights in the hotel. Room is small, but well equipped, clean and quiet. Bed is comfy and big Stylish room, and 5 minutes from Gare St Lazard. Don't expect any view, but who cares for this price!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant hotel on the edge of the centre of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Paperpusher39
Reviews.Content: Stayed just one night at this hotel based on the previous reviews. Had a smallish but very good,clean tidy room on the forth floor. No views there, but no complaints at all. Friendly staff on reception, quiet location, five minute walk to Saint Lazare Station and metro stop.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Scottishtraveller81
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for two nights and found the hotel to be well appointed, clean and with a good location within Paris. The staff were very friendly and happy to help in any way they could. The free use of the laptop was also a nice touch. Rates were reasonable and would certainly return to this great little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “If you have to be stuck in Paris this is a great place to be stuck!”
Reviews.Author: Lindy61
Reviews.Content: We needed a hotel near to the St Lazarre station fffffffto get the train to LeHavre for the last leg of our return from Italy during the Volcanic ash incident, This hotel was reasonably priced the room was clean , modern and extremely comfortable . It wasn't very big but it was adequate for our needsThe shower screen was a daft design and breakfast wasn't included and we thought it was expensive. Service was friendly and we had a great night's sleep in the middle of a stressful jou

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jesso
Reviews.Content: After looking at a lot of hotels in Paris, we finally decided to stay here and we are both very glad we did! We had one of the best rooms on the top floor, great bathroom and room and we even had a balcony with a distant view of the eiffel tower. The staff were very friendly and very helpful. The spoke great english. we had breakfast there one day, it was fairly average for the price, would recommend grabbiing something from a little deli 20m from the hotel and just get walking instead. The hotel was in a great spot, easy to walk everywhere and very very close to the maiin train station.

Reviews.Title: “Jewel of a hotel in central Paris”
Reviews.Author: DutchSpain
Reviews.Content: My compliments to a conscientious staff who care about their hotel. Clean classic luxury playful, quiet. No smell of smoke! Perfectly located near teh station and to restaurants. Kind staff. Well priced. Bedlinnen and bed .. best i have Had in Paris ..

Reviews.Title: “Womderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: sidgimp
Reviews.Content: Just returned from three nights at Wilson hotel. The hotel is beautifully decorated as you can see from the hotel photos. It's location is excellent on a quiet little side street but within two minutws walk of many shops bars and restaurants. It is also a couple of minutes walk from the tube station, however as we had a baby in a pram we walked everywhere and did not use the tube, busses or taxis. That is the beauty of the hotels location. The staff were very helpful, particularly Yadira on reception, for whom nothing was too much troble. She organised a travel cot to be made up and waiting in our room on arrival, she e-mailed directions to us before our arrival, suggested places to eat and provided us with a map for our stay. In short a wonderful long weekend, made better bu a wonderful hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very cozy little place with friendly stuff and free wi fi”
Reviews.Author: Katya81
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed staying in WO hotel. It's very nice and clean and with those little details which add charm and cosiness. Staff is very friendly and helpful. I could mention just 2 small minuses. Curtain in the bathroom let water to flood the floor and pillows are too big and firm. But that is insignificant.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay”
Reviews.Author: frogmail
Reviews.Content: A very centrally located hotel on a quiet little street - the staff were very welcoming and helpful and while the room was small it was nicely decorated, extremely clean, modern and well equipped. A great and comfortable base for exploring Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: HollyHouse2003
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from 2 nights at this hotel and cannot praise it too highly! Our room on the top floor was spacious and quiet. The service was great, they even popped out for fresh croissant when we arrived for a late breakfast. Location is conveniently close to St Lazer or the smaller Europe station.

Reviews.Title: “Great little place”
Reviews.Author: RobinKirsty
Reviews.Content: Neat little room with everything provided for a comfortable stay. Very good interior decor and all kept in immaculate order. Staff were all very friendly and efficient. The (totally unexpected) touch of rose petals and chocolates awaiting in our room on Valentine's evening highlighted how much the hotel cares about its customers. The location was great with easy access to St Lazare train/metro station for when our feet got tired. Would definitely return to stay at Hotel WO.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel WO - Wilson Opera
HotelInfo.Address: 10 rue de Stockholm, 75008 Paris, France
